scenes.location: NUMBER FOUR PRIVET DRIVE MIDDLE OF THE NIGHT 1
characters: CRATES. HUGE ROLLING BINS. A WOOD STAIRCASE. A

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The street slumbers, adrift in shadow. Then... a curious BEAM OF LIGHT BOBS beyond the second-story window of Number Four.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: A tent of blankets. Within... the SHADOW of a BOY. A

dialogues.speaker: HARRY
dialogues.text: Lumos Maxima... The tent BLOOMS SOFTLY with light -- briefly illuminating a bedside PHOTOGRAPH (of James & Lily Potter) -- then goes dark.

dialogues.speaker: HARRY
dialogues.text: Lumos Maxima... The blankets bloom once again when, down the hall, a TOILET FLUSHES. Instantly, the SHADOW stiffens, the blankets DIM, and the tent flattens. Just as... ... the bedroom door OPENS, revealing... UNCLE VERNON. He peers inside, eyes flashing suspiciously, then... withdraws. The tent rises.

dialogues.speaker: HARRY
dialogues.text: Lumos Maxima... As the blankets blaze, we CUT INSIDE, find a SKINNY BOY with a crow's nest of black hair, thick glasses sitting crookedly atop his nose: HARRY POTTER. Open before him is Violeta Stitch's Extreme Incantations. Once again, he speaks:

dialogues.speaker: HARRY
dialogues.text: Lumos... MAXIMA!

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: A BLINDING BLAST OF LIGHT FLASHES from the second story window of Number Four. DOGS BARK. And a TITLE CARD appears:

dialogues.speaker: HARRY POTTER
dialogues.text: and the Prisoner of Azkaban

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: thru

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The light in the hallway SNAPS on, Harry's tent droops once more and, seconds later, Harry's door eases open. Uncle Vernon peers in and switches on the light. The room is utterly SILENT. Slowly, he closes the door.

dialogues.speaker: OMITTED 3
dialogues.text: thru 5

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The DOORBELL CHIMES and a shrill VOICE THUNDERS:

dialogues.speaker: AUNT PETUNIA, (0.S.)
dialogues.text: Harry! Harry! Harry bounds down the stairs and into the front hall, where his AUNT PETUNIA and cousin DUDLEY stand stiffly. Petunia flicks a bit of fluff from Dudley's sweater, glowers crossly at Harry, and jerks her head toward the door.

dialogues.speaker: AUNT PETUNIA
dialogues.text: Well, go on. Open it. Harry reaches for the knob when -- BLAM! -- it BURSTS OPEN, revealing a LARGE, WADDLING WOMAN (AUNT MARGE) and a LARGE WADDLING BULLDOG (RIPPER). Uncle Vernon lurches forward out of the teeming RAIN, an ENORMOUS SUITCASE in hand, and drops it on Harry.

dialogues.speaker: AUNT PETUNIA
dialogues.text: Marge! Welcome! How was the train?

dialogues.speaker: AUNT MARGE
dialogues.text: Wretched. Ripper got sick.

dialogues.speaker: AUNT PETUNIA
dialogues.text: Ah. How... unfortunate.

dialogues.speaker: AUNT MARGE
dialogues.text: I would've left him with the others, but he pines so when I'm away. Don't you, darling? Aunt Marge puckers her lips at Ripper and leads him down the hallway. Harry follows with Uncle Vernon. (CONTINUED )

dialogues.speaker: HARRY
dialogues.text: Uncle Vernon. I need you to sign this form.

dialogues.speaker: UNCLE VERNON
dialogues.text: What is it?

dialogues.speaker: HARRY
dialogues.text: Nothing. Something for school... Uncle Vernon eyes the PARCHMENT in Harry's hand suspiciously.

dialogues.speaker: UNCLE VERNON
dialogues.text: Later perhaps. If you behave.

dialogues.speaker: HARRY
dialogues.text: I will if she does.

dialogues.speaker: AUNT MARGE
dialogues.text: (turning, eyeing Harry) So. Still here, are you?

dialogues.speaker: HARRY
dialogues.text: Yes.

dialogues.speaker: AUNT MARGE
dialogues.text: Don’t say 'yes' in that ungrateful tone. Damn good of my brother to keep you, if you ask me. (to Vernon, Petunia) It'd have been straight to an orphanage if he'd been dumped on my doorstep. Just then Dudley -- sitting comatose before the TV -- emits a HOLLOW, BRAIN-DEAD CHUCKLE.

dialogues.speaker: AUNT MARGE
dialogues.text: Is that my Dudders! Hm? Is that my neffy poo? Come and say hello to your Auntie Marge. Marge flashes a thick FAN of POUND NOTES. Dudley blinks, waddles forward, and extends his plump palm obediently. Harry looks on, then sees Ripper snuffling about his ankle.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: As Harry clears the dishes, Uncle Vernon brings out a bottle of brandy. (CONTINUED )

dialogues.speaker: UNCLE VERNON
dialogues.text: Can I tempt you, Marge?

dialogues.speaker: AUNT MARGE
dialogues.text: Just a small one. A bit more... a bit more... That's the boy. (taking a sloppy sip) Aah. Excellent nosh, Petunia. It's normally just a fry-up for me, what with twelve dogs. She smacks her lips, lowers her brandy, and lets Ripper take a slobbery lap out of the glass... then catches Harry looking.

dialogues.speaker: AUNT MARGE
dialogues.text: What are you smirking at! Where is it that you send him, Vernon?

dialogues.speaker: UNCLE VERNON
dialogues.text: St. Brutus's. It's a first-rate institution for hopeless cases. Hearing this, Harry frowns, glances at Uncle Vernon, who glares darkly at him.

dialogues.speaker: AUNT MARGE
dialogues.text: I see. And do they use the cane at St. Brutus's, boy?

dialogues.speaker: HARRY
dialogues.text: (sarcastically) Oh, yes. I've been beaten loads of times.

dialogues.speaker: AUNT MARGE
dialogues.text: Excellent. I won't have this namby-pamby wishy-washy nonsense about not hitting people who deserve it. (another sip) Still. Mustn't blame yourself for how this one's turned out, Vernon. It all comes down to blood. Bad blood will out. What is it the boy's father did, Petunia?

dialogues.speaker: AUNT PETUNIA
dialogues.text: (agitated) Nothing. That is... he didn't work. He was -- unemployed. (CONTINUED )

dialogues.speaker: AUNT MARGE
dialogues.text: Of course. And a drunk, I expect --

dialogues.speaker: HARRY
dialogues.text: That's a lie. Aunt Marge pauses on her wine, eyes narrowing on Harry.

dialogues.speaker: AUNT MARGE
dialogues.text: What did you say?

dialogues.speaker: HARRY
dialogues.text: My dad wasn't a drunk. POP! The GLASS in Aunt Marge's hand EXPLODES.

dialogues.speaker: AUNT PETUNIA
dialogues.text: Oh my goodness! Marge!

dialogues.speaker: AUNT MARGE
dialogues.text: Not to worry, Petunia. I have a very firm grip. Harry stares at the shattered glass in surprise.

dialogues.speaker: UNCLE VERNON
dialogues.text: You go to bed. Now.

dialogues.speaker: AUNT MARGE
dialogues.text: Quiet, Vernon. It doesn't matter about the father. In the end it comes down to the mother. You see it all the time with dogs. If there's something wrong with the bitch, there'll be something wrong with the pup...

dialogues.speaker: HARRY
dialogues.text: Shut up! Shut up! Aunt Marge starts to reply, when -- ZING! -- a BUTTON on her dress sails into the air. SEAMS GROAN. THREAD SNAPS. Aunt Marge's eyes WIDEN. Her cheeks BILLOW. Her whole body BILLOWS. And she begins to INFLATE like a MONSTROUS BALLOON.

dialogues.speaker: MARGE
dialogues.text: As she rises, Uncle Vernon leaps for her. RIPPER GROWLS, fixes his teeth to his trousers. Harry frightened by what he's done, watches Aunt Marge BOUNCE GENTLY across the ceiling and into the CONSERVATORY.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The others race outside. As Aunt Marge begins to float away, Uncle Vernon grips her hands.

dialogues.speaker: UNCLE VERNON
dialogues.text: Don't worry! I've got you... Slowly... to his horror... Uncle Vernon himself begins to RISE. Aunt Marge looks fearfully into his eyes...

dialogues.speaker: AUNT MARGE
dialogues.text: Vernon. Don't you dare -- But he does. He lets go. Falls to his knees. And watches Aunt Marge float away.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Harry crashes inside, takes his TRUNK, then puts his heel to a LOOSE FLOORBOARD and removes his WAND from its hiding place. Turning, he grabs the PHOTOGRAPH of his parents.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: BOOM! BOOM! BOOM! Harry tows the TRUNK down the stairs... finds Uncle Vernon waiting for him.

dialogues.speaker: HARRY
dialogues.text: No! She deserved what she got! And you... you keep away from me. Uncle Vernon eyes Harry's wand nervously, then grins with knowing cruelty.

dialogues.speaker: UNCLE VERNON
dialogues.text: You're not allowed to do magic out of school. They won't have you now. You've got nowhere to go. Harry realizes it's true. Briefly falters. Then:

dialogues.speaker: HARRY
dialogues.text: Anywhere's better than here.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: As Harry storms out with his trunk, we DOLLY TO the street WITH him. High in the sky, a plump DOT rises. Aunt Marge.  10

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Harry walks and walks and walks, then... stops. Glances about. An empty PLAYGROUND. SWINGS CREAKING gently on rusted chains. A tiny CAROUSEL, kissed gently by the wind, turning slowly. Harry drops the trunk. Sits. Deep in the night, an ALARM SHRIEKS, goes SILENT. Harry, still as a statue. Listening. In the trees above, LEAVES TREMBLE. The WIND gathers. Harry turns, studies the swaying swings, the carousel. Then, he... stiffens. Turns back. Sensing something in the shadows across the street, he rises. Slowly draws his wand. Then he sees... it. Something BIG. Darker than the shadows which conceal it. Something with WIDE, GLEAMING EYES. Harry steps back. Afraid to look. Afraid not to. Wand outstretched... he TRIPS, tumbles over the forgotten trunk. The tip of his wand BLAZES. BANG! TWIN BEAMS of BLINDING LIGHT spear the night.

dialogues.speaker: HARRY
dialogues.text: Aaaah! GIANT WHEELS bear down. Harry rolls clear -- just as a PREPOSTEROUSLY PURPLE, TRIPLE-DECKER BUS SCREECHES to a halt. GOLD LETTERS glimmer above the windscreen: The Knight Bus. DOORS HISS. Snap back. REVEAL STAN SHUNPIKE, an 18- year-old boy in a WRINKLED CONDUCTOR'S UNIFORM. Pasty face. Raccoon eyes. Stan looks like he hasn't seen the sun in years.

dialogues.speaker: STAN SHUNPIKE
dialogues.text: (wearily, drearily) Welcome to the Knight Bus. Emergency transport for the stranded witch or wizard. My name is Stan Shunpike, and I will be your conductor this evening. (peering at Harry) Wha' choo doin' down there?

dialogues.speaker: HARRY
dialogues.text: Fell over.

dialogues.speaker: STAN SHUNPIKE
dialogues.text: Wha' choo fall over for? (CONTINUED )

dialogues.speaker: HARRY
dialogues.text: I didn't do it on purpose. Stan eyes Harry suspiciously, nods slowly.

dialogues.speaker: STAN SHUNPIKE
dialogues.text: Well, come on then. Let's not wait for the grass to grow. As Stan grabs Harry's trunk, Harry peers into the shadows across the street -- now simply shadows -- and climbs aboard.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: No seats. Only BEDS. The BRASS frames need a shine, the lines a wash. In one bed, a DISHEVELED WIZARD GRUNTS, turns over in his sleep.

dialogues.speaker: DISHEVELED WIZARD
dialogues.text: Not now... I'm pickling slugs... Behind the wheel, ERNIE, an UNSHAVEN WIZARD in THICK GLASSES, stares straight ahead, armpits stained with sweat. A SHRUNKEN HEAD dangles from the rearview mirror, MUTTERING incessantly through the STITCHES that lace its mouth.

dialogues.speaker: STAN SHUNPIKE
dialogues.text: Take ‘er away, Ern.

dialogues.speaker: SHRUNKEN HEAD
dialogues.text: Yeah, take it away! BANG! Ernie rockets away and the beds -- as one -- slide six inches to the rear. Harry drops onto the bed nearest, peers up at the CHANDELIER SWAYING directly above his head. Beyond the windscreen ONCOMING TRAFFIC WHIPS past in a blur.

dialogues.speaker: STAN SHUNPIKE
dialogues.text: Wot you say your name was again?

dialogues.speaker: HARRY
dialogues.text: I didn't. Stan, huddled in an armchair, peeks over The Daily Prophet, eyes Harry coolly, before disappearing once more. Harry brushes the fringe of his hair over his scar, watches an AMBULANCE -- SIREN WAILING -- careen past. (CONTINUED )

dialogues.speaker: STAN SHUNPIKE
dialogues.text: Whereabouts you headin'? Harry hesitates. He hadn't thought about this. Decides.

dialogues.speaker: HARRY
dialogues.text: The Leaky Cauldron. That's in London --

dialogues.speaker: STAN SHUNPIKE
dialogues.text: Is it now? Get that, Ern? The Leaky Cauldron. That's in London. Stan grins with sinister delight, showing BAD TEETH.

dialogues.speaker: SHRUNKEN HEAD
dialogues.text: Leaky Cauldron! Stay away from the pea soup! As the Shrunken Head CACKLES with delight, Harry peers out the windscreen, watches London careering by.

dialogues.speaker: HARRY
dialogues.text: Isn't this a bit... dangerous?

dialogues.speaker: STAN SHUNPIKE
dialogues.text: Naah. Haven't had an accident in -- what? -- a week is it, Ern?

dialogues.speaker: SHRUNKEN HEAD
dialogues.text: Heads up! Little old lady at twelve o'clock! Sure enough, directly ahead, a LITTLE OLD LADY is crossing the street. Ernie HITS the BRAKES HARD and Harry flies forward, palms to the window. The brakes pinch down, the bus stops inches from the old lady, and Harry flies back onto his bed. BANG! The bus rockets forward once more. As Harry rights himself, he notices the HEADLINE of Stan's Daily Prophet: ESCAPE FROM AZKABAN! Below, a sunken-faced MAN with long, matted hair glowers from a MOVING PHOTOGRAPH.

dialogues.speaker: HARRY
dialogues.text: Who is that? That man.

dialogues.speaker: STAN SHUNPIKE
dialogues.text: Who is that? That's Sirius Black, that is. Don' tell me you ne'er been hearin' o' Sirius Black? (CONTINUED )

dialogues.speaker: CONTINUED
dialogues.text: Harry shakes his head, still staring at the man's face.

dialogues.speaker: STAN SHUNPIKE
dialogues.text: A murderer, he is. Got ‘imself locked up in Azkaban for it.

dialogues.speaker: HARRY
dialogues.text: How'd he escape?

dialogues.speaker: STAN SHUNPIKE
dialogues.text: Tha's the question, isn't it? He's the firs' that's done it. Gives me the collywobbles thinking he's out there, though, I'll tell you that. Big supporter of You- Know-'0o, Black was. Reckon you heard o' him. Harry nods and, as he does, Black's eyes shift. Meet Harry's.

dialogues.speaker: HARRY
dialogues.text: Yeah. Him I've heard of. Just then, a pair of DOUBLE-DECKER BUSES sweep directly toward the Knight Bus. Before can scream, the entire Knight Bus SQUEEZES DOWN and shoots the gap between the two onrushing buses. The Shrunken Head winces.

dialogues.speaker: SHRUNKEN HEAD
dialogues.text: Hate that.

dialogues.speaker: HARRY
dialogues.text: This bus. Don't the Muggles ever...

dialogues.speaker: STAN SHUNPIKE
dialogues.text: Them! Don' listen properly, do they? Don' look properly either. Never notice nuffink, they don'. Just then, a COUPLE walking a DOG are engulfed by a RUSH of WIND as the (invisible) Knight Bus WHOOSHES past. The couple glances about in bewilderment. The DOG YAPS madly.

dialogues.speaker: SHRUNKEN HEAD
dialogues.text: Turn! Turn! Ernie fans the wheel, sending the Knight Bus into a dizzying 360-degree turn. HEADLIGHTS pinwheel past the windows as the bus rides up on two wheels and Harry is sent flying once more. Grabbing fast to the center POLE, he pirouettes through the air when Ernie... SLAMS on the BRAKES.  12

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The Knight Bus fishtails INTO VIEW and SQUEALS to a stop, centimeters from a PARKED CAR. WHOOSH! The bus settles and -- TINK! -- taps the bumper. Instantly, the car's ALARM wails.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The chandelier sways drunkenly as the bus doors open. The steps GROAN with heavy feet and a FIGURE appears: TOM, Innkeeper of the Leaky Cauldron pub.

dialogues.speaker: TOM
dialogues.text: Mr. Potter... at last.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: As the Knight Bus rockets off, Tom and Harry are revealed, Harry glances up, reads the SIGN above: THE LEAKY CAULDRON. Tom drags Harry's trunk inside, then pauses and, with a FLICK of his wand, silences the car alarm.

dialogues.speaker: LATER
dialogues.text: Harry trails Tom through the quiet room. The BARTENDER glances up, his gaze lingering perhaps a bit too long. A solitary WIZARD reads a book while, at his elbow, his COFFEE CUP STIRS ITSELF. Tom leads Harry upstairs.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: As Harry follows Tom inside, he finds a SNOW WHITE OWL (HEDWIG) perched atop a chair.

dialogues.speaker: HARRY
dialogues.text: Hedwig!

dialogues.speaker: TOM
dialogues.text: Right smart bird you've got there, Mr. Potter. Arrived only minutes before yourself. A MAN CLEARS his throat. Harry turns, finds a PINSTRIPED SILHOUETTE (CORNELIUS FUDGE) at the window, staring at the ghostly shadows beyond. Harry's reflection shivers in the glass, but the man doesn't turn. Tom takes a position against the wall, fishes a pair of WALNUTS from his pocket and -- CRACK -- crushes the shells between his palms. (CONTINUED)

dialogues.speaker: CORNELIUS FUDGE
dialogues.text: I should tell you, Mr. Potter, earlier this evening your uncle's sister was located just south of Sheffield, circling a chimney stack. The Accidental Magic Reversal Department was dispatched and she's been properly punctured and her memory modified. She has no recollection of the incident whatsoever. Harry waits. A man condemned. Then Fudge turns.

dialogues.speaker: CORNELIUS FUDGE
dialogues.text: So that's that, and no harm done. (smiling) Pea soup? Harry glances warily from the steaming TUREEN of GREEN to Tom, who works a grimy thumb into his gum, frees a walnut sliver.

dialogues.speaker: HARRY
dialogues.text: No thank you. Minister... I don't understand. I broke the law. Underage wizards aren't allowed to use magic at home --

dialogues.speaker: CORNELIUS FUDGE
dialogues.text: (dishing up a bowl) Oh, come now, Harry. The Ministry doesn't send people to Azkaban for blowing up their aunts! On the other hand... running away like that... given the state of things... very, very irresponsible.

dialogues.speaker: HARRY
dialogues.text: 'The state of things' sir?

dialogues.speaker: CORNELIUS FUDGE
dialogues.text: We have a killer on the loose.

dialogues.speaker: HARRY
dialogues.text: Sirius Black, you mean. But... what's that got to do with me? CRACK! Tom SHATTERS another WALNUT. Fudge smiles nervously. (CONTINUED )

dialogues.speaker: CORNELIUS FUDGE
dialogues.text: Hm? Oh, nothing. You're safe, that's what matters. Tomorrow you'll be on your way to Hogwarts. These are your new schoolbooks. I took the liberty of having them brought here for you. Harry eyes the STACK of BOOKS. One is bound by a ROPE.

dialogues.speaker: CORNELIUS FUDGE
dialogues.text: By the way, Harry. Whilst you're here it would be best if you didn't... wander.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: THROUGH the window: the rooftops of London. A TRAIN PASSES and CAMERA PULLS BACK, REVEALS Harry, standing with Hedwig. He turns, eyes his schoolbooks. He studies the GROWLING TOME -- The Monster Book of Monsters -- then gives the rope a tug. Instantly... -.. the book LEAPS to the floor, pages flying, bookcovers SNAPPING. Harry gives chase, then the book turns, begins NIPPING viciously at his shoes. Harry vaults atop the bed, watches the book disappear underneath, then grabs a PILLOW. Seconds later, the book scuttles into view and Harry POUNCES -- FLUMPH! The BOOK ROARS angrily, muffled beneath the pillow. Harry takes the ROPE, prepares to rebind it.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: A YOUNG WITCH in maid's robes pushes a cart down the hall. Harry exits his room as the witch KNOCKS on a door.

dialogues.speaker: YOUNG WITCH
dialogues.text: Housekeeping. As she opens the door, she's greeted by a THUNDEROUS ROAR and a RUSH of WIND.

dialogues.speaker: YOUNG WITCH
dialogues.text: (unperturbed) I'll come back later. (CONTINUED )

dialogues.speaker: CONTINUED
dialogues.text: Something SMALL and FAST dashes by Harry's feet. Looking, he spies a rather ragged-looking RAT (SCABBERS), pursued by a decidedly UGLY ORANGE CAT (CROOKSHANKS).

dialogues.speaker: OMITTED 18
dialogues.text: thru 22

dialogues.speaker: LATER
dialogues.text: As Harry moves down the stairs, VOICES come from below.

dialogues.speaker: RON, (0.S.)
dialogues.text: I'm warning you, Hermione! Keep that bloody beast of yours away from Scabbers or I'll turn it into a tea cozy.

dialogues.speaker: HERMIONE, (0.S.)
dialogues.text: He's a cat, Ronald! What do you expect? It's in his nature. As Harry reaches bottom, he finds RON WEASLEY protectively cradling Scabbers, while HERMIONE GRANDER does her best to restrain a HISSING Crookshanks.

dialogues.speaker: RON
dialogues.text: A cat! Is that what they told you? Looks more like a pig with hair if you ask me.

dialogues.speaker: HERMIONE
dialogues.text: That's rich coming from the owner of that smelly old shoe brush. (cooing to the cat) It's all right, Crookshanks. You just ignore the mean little boy... Then, sensing another presence in the room, both turn.

dialogues.speaker: HERMIONE/RON
dialogues.text: Harry.

dialogues.speaker: A DOG-EARED CLIPPING
dialogues.text: from The Daily Prophet. (CONTINUED)

dialogues.speaker: A HEADLINE SCREAMS
dialogues.text: In the accompanying PHOTO, the entire WEASLEY FAMILY stands before the GREAT PYRAMIDS, waving. Smack in the middle is Ron, Scabbers perched on his shoulder.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: As Ron smoothes the dog-eared clipping onto the table, Harry studies it. Hermione ignores it, stroking Crookshanks.

dialogues.speaker: HARRY
dialogues.text: Egypt! What's it like?

dialogues.speaker: RON
dialogues.text: Brilliant. It's got loads of old stuff. Mummies. Death masks. Tombs --

dialogues.speaker: HERMIONE
dialogues.text: You know, the ancient Egyptians of the Nile River delta worshipped the cat goddess Bast. Ron glares stonily at Hermione, then turns back to Harry.

dialogues.speaker: RON
dialogues.text: I also got a new wand. Just then, a COMMOTION is HEARD. The Weasleys -- PERCY, FRED, GEORGE, GINNY, ARTHUR, and MOLLY -- arrive en masse, laden with purchases from Diagon Alley.

dialogues.speaker: GEORGE
dialogues.text: Not flashing that clipping about again, are you, Ron?

dialogues.speaker: RON
dialogues.text: I haven't shown anyone!

dialogues.speaker: FRED
dialogues.text: No, not a soul. Unless you count Tom. The day maid. The night maid. The cook. The bloke that came to fix the toilet. That wizard from Belgium... Mrs. Weasley takes Harry's face in her hands, smiles. As if relieved to see him.

dialogues.speaker: MRS. WEASLEY
dialogues.text: It's good to see you, Harry. (CONTINUED )

dialogues.speaker: HARRY
dialogues.text: Good to see you too, Mrs. Weasley

dialogues.speaker: 23A
dialogues.text: Harry. I wonder if I might have a word.

dialogues.speaker: HARRY
dialogues.text: Of course, Mr. Weasley. As Mr. Weasley pulls Harry away, the others hover over the clipping in the b.g.

dialogues.speaker: FRED
dialogues.text: George's nose looks positively massive in that photograph.

dialogues.speaker: GINNY
dialogues.text: That's your nose, Fred.

dialogues.speaker: FRED
dialogues.text: Bloody hell. ‘Tis, isn't it? Take after your side of the family, don't I, Mum? continue to Harry notices Mr. Weasley glance edgily at a FUGITIVE POSTER tacked to the wall. In it, SIRIUS BLACK glowers under the words, "Have You Seen This Man?"

dialogues.speaker: ARTHUR WEASLEY
dialogues.text: Harry. There are some within the Ministry who would strongly discourage me from divulging what I'm about to tell you. But I think you need to know the facts. Because you're in danger. Grave danger. Harry's eyes drift to the fugitive poster.

dialogues.speaker: HARRY
dialogues.text: Has this anything to do with him, sir?

dialogues.speaker: ARTHUR WEASLEY
dialogues.text: What do you know of Sirius Black, Harry?

dialogues.speaker: HARRY
dialogues.text: That he escaped from Azkaban. That he killed someone... (CONTINUED )

dialogues.speaker: ARTHUR WEASLEY
dialogues.text: Harry, thirteen years ago, when you stopped... Mr. Weasley hesitates, unable to continue.

dialogues.speaker: HARRY
dialogues.text: Voldemort...?

dialogues.speaker: ARTHUR WEASLEY
dialogues.text: (nodding nervously) Black lost everything. But he remains a loyal servant to this day. In his mind, only you stand in the way of... Once again, Mr. Weasley hesitates.

dialogues.speaker: HARRY
dialogues.text: Voldemort...?

dialogues.speaker: ARTHUR WEASLEY
dialogues.text: Harry, I hate it when you say --

dialogues.speaker: HARRY
dialogues.text: I know, sorry. Ron hates it too.

dialogues.speaker: ARTHUR WEASLEY
dialogues.text: In Black's mind, only you stand in the way of... You-Know-Who returning to power. That's why he's broken. That's why he's broken out of Azkaban. To find you. And... Mr. Weasley hesitates yet again.

dialogues.speaker: HARRY
dialogues.text: Kill me? Mr. Weasley nods. Nervously.

dialogues.speaker: ARTHUR WEASLEY
dialogues.text: Harry. I want you to swear that -- whatever you might hear -- you won't go looking for Black.

dialogues.speaker: HARRY
dialogues.text: Mr. Weasley, why would I go looking for someone who wants to kill me? Mr. Weasley nods, then claps Harry on the shoulder. (CONTINUED )

dialogues.speaker: ARTHUR WEASLEY
dialogues.text: Just watch yourself, will you, Harry?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: As the HOGWARTS EXPRESS BLEATS ITS HORN, we CRANE OVER the milling horde of students. Parents hurry their children onboard, tiny siblings wave goodbyes... and Mr. Weasley dashes through the throng and up to an open train window.

dialogues.speaker: MRS. WEASLEY
dialogues.text: Ron! She hands Scabbers through the open window to him.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The aisle teems with students. Harry, Ron and Hermione work their way down the aisle, looking for an empty compartment.

dialogues.speaker: HARRY
dialogues.text: I didn't mean to blow her up. I just... (troubled by the memory) ++. lost control.

dialogues.speaker: RON
dialogues.text: Brilliant!

dialogues.speaker: HERMIONE
dialogues.text: Honestly, Ron, it's not funny. Harry's lucky he wasn't expelled.

dialogues.speaker: RON
dialogues.text: I still think it was brilliant. SNAP! SNAP! SNAP! A copy of the The Monster Book of Monsters SCUTTLES CRAB-LIKE down the aisle, pursued by NEVILLE LONGBOTTOM.

dialogues.speaker: NEVILLE
dialogues.text: Hi, Harry. Ron. Hermione. (CONTINUED )

dialogues.speaker: HARRY /HERMIONE/RON
dialogues.text: Hi, Neville. As he bumps past, Hermione nods to a compartment.

dialogues.speaker: HERMIONE
dialogues.text: C'mon. We're in here.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: As they slip inside, they find a MAN in SHABBY ROBES (PROFESSOR LUPIN) slumped against the window, asleep. He looks ill, exhausted. The trio eye him warily. WHISPER.

dialogues.speaker: RON
dialogues.text: Who d'you reckon he is?

dialogues.speaker: HERMIONE
dialogues.text: Professor R.J. Lupin.

dialogues.speaker: RON
dialogues.text: You know everything. How is it she knows everything?

dialogues.speaker: HERMIONE
dialogues.text: It's on his case. She points. Stamped in peeling letters on a BATTERED CASE is "Professor R.J. Lupin."

dialogues.speaker: HARRY
dialogues.text: Is he really asleep?

dialogues.speaker: HERMIONE
dialogues.text: Seems to be. Why? What is it, Harry?

dialogues.speaker: HARRY
dialogues.text: Close the door. Hermione and Ron exchange a curious glance, then Ron rises, slides the door shut, OVER CAMERA, and we -- cut TO:

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Storm clouds, like dark ghosts, toss SHEETS of RAIN onto the scarlet engine as it heads north.  30 31 32 21.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Ron and Hermione stare at Harry, faces stricken in the lantern light that now glows in the compartment. Crookshanks slumbers in his CAGE.

dialogues.speaker: RON
dialogues.text: Let me get this straight. Sirius Black escaped from Azkaban to come after you?

dialogues.speaker: HARRY
dialogues.text: Yes.

dialogues.speaker: HERMIONE
dialogues.text: But they'll catch Black, won't they? I mean... eventually?

dialogues.speaker: RON
dialogues.text: Sure -- Of course, no one's ever broken out of Azkaban before and he's a raving, murderous lunatic... Just then, the COMPARTMENT RATTLES. Lanterns flicker. The train LURCHES, begins to SLOW. Hermione slides down the seat, pinning Ron against the window. They exchange an awkward glance, then Hermione carefully slides to the other end of the seat and glances at her WATCH. Frowns.

dialogues.speaker: HERMIONE
dialogues.text: Why're we stopping? We can't be there yet... Harry rises, slides open the door, peers into the corridor. HARRY'S POV -- All along the carriage, HEADS look out curiously. Then -- the train JERKS -- the car SWAYS -- and the LAMPS running along the ceiling FLICKER and...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: ».. die. One by one. Until all is...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Dark.

dialogues.speaker: RON
dialogues.text: What's going on? (CONTINUED )

dialogues.speaker: CONTINUED
dialogues.text: A thin WISP of STEAM escapes Ron's mouth. Harry notices.

dialogues.speaker: HARRY
dialogues.text: Dunno... Maybe we've broken down?

dialogues.speaker: HERMIONE
dialogues.text: Ouch! Ron, that was my foot! SQUEAK-SQUEAK-SQUEAK. Ron, a dark silhouette against the window, wipes a patch of condensation from the window.

dialogues.speaker: RON
dialogues.text: There's something moving out there. I think... people are coming aboard. Suddenly the CAR SWAYS violently... rights itself. The METAL WINDOW TRIM at Ron's fingertips begins to VIBRATE.

dialogues.speaker: RON
dialogues.text: Bloody hell. What's happening? SSSSST! A soft CRACKLING fills the car and FLAMES bloom... in the hands of R.J. Lupin. In the SHIVERING LIGHT, his face looks tired and gray, but his eyes are alert. Wary.

dialogues.speaker: PROFESSOR LUPIN
dialogues.text: Don't. Move. A HAND -- slimy and scabbed -- a hand of death -- GRIPS the half-open compartment door, pushes it aside. REVEALS: a TOWERING, CLOAKED FIGURE, its face hidden beneath its black hood. CROOKSHANKS' hair rises and as she HISSES... WHOOSHHHHH. The folds of the hood TREMBLE. A CHILL, RATTLING INTAKE OF AIR is heard. The FLAMES in Lupin's hands SPUTTER. A SOUND SWELLS in Harry's ears. Eerie. Painful. The sound of a WOMAN SCREAMING. Harry's eyes roll up, eyelids fluttering. And then... a SILVERY WHITE LIGHT drifts from his mouth. The world spins off its axis and Harry falls... glasses tumbling hard to the ground... then Harry... the muscles of his jaw twitching. THUNDER CRACKS. LIGHTNING paints the ICY windows... WHITE. BLACK. WHITE. (CONTINUED )

dialogues.speaker: BLACK...
dialogues.text: With a DESPERATE GASP, Harry opens his eyes. Blinks. DUSK IS GONE. The windows BLACK. The floor at his spine is SHAKING GENTLY. The train moving again. His eyes shift, see a DROP OF WATER, newly unfrozen, running slowly down the window.

dialogues.speaker: HERMIONE
dialogues.text: Harry? Harry, are you all right? Hermione's troubled face hovers above him. He nods. Sits up. Ron -- pale, nervous -- extends his hand. Harry's glasses.

dialogues.speaker: HARRY
dialogues.text: Thanks. Harry slips them on. Discovers the cold sweat glazing his brow. SNAP! Professor Lupin breaks a ragged triangle of CHOCOLATE off the SLAB in his hands. Holds it out.

dialogues.speaker: PROFESSOR LUPIN
dialogues.text: Chocolate. Eat. It'll help.

dialogues.speaker: HARRY
dialogues.text: What was that -- that thing?

dialogues.speaker: PROFESSOR LUPIN
dialogues.text: A Dementor. One of the guards of Azkaban. It's gone now. Harry frowns in confusion.

dialogues.speaker: HERMIONE
dialogues.text: It was searching the train, Harry. For Sirius Black.

dialogues.speaker: PROFESSOR LUPIN
dialogues.text: I need to have a word with the driver. Excuse me. (the chocolate) Eat. It'll help. As he leaves, Harry turns to Ron and Hermione.

dialogues.speaker: HARRY
dialogues.text: What happened to me? (CONTINUED )

dialogues.speaker: RON
dialogues.text: Well, you sort of went... rigid. We thought maybe you were having a fit or something.

dialogues.speaker: HARRY
dialogues.text: And did either of you? You know... pass out?

dialogues.speaker: RON
dialogues.text: No. I felt... weird. Like I'd never be cheerful again. But... no. Harry turns to Hermione. She shakes her head.

dialogues.speaker: HERMIONE
dialogues.text: I was trembling. Cold. But then... Professor Lupin made it go away...

dialogues.speaker: HARRY
dialogues.text: But someone was screaming. A woman. Hermione and Ron glance nervously at each other.

dialogues.speaker: HERMIONE
dialogues.text: No one was screaming, Harry. Harry looks to the window and we PUSH IN ON his REFLECTION. It becomes a GLIMMERING PUDDLE and...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: SPLASH!... a CARRIAGE WHEEL shatters the glassy surface as we TILT UP, catch a procession of HORSELESS CARRIAGES, carrying students toward the glimmering castle. Gradually, the sweet sound of a CHOIR rises on the air, a FLASH of LIGHTNING bleaches the night sky and we -- cut TO:

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: ... the CAMERA as it GLIDES TOWARD the windows of the Great Hall, TOWARD the CANDLELIT SILHOUETTES glimmering within, PASSING THROUGH the glass. (CONTINUED )

dialogues.speaker: CONTINUED
dialogues.text: At the High Table, Lupin sits with SEVERUS SNAPE, MINERVA McGONAGALL, RUBEUS HAGRID and ALBUS DUMBLEDORE. We TRACK ALONG the FACES of the choir, singing to the strains of a HARPSICHORD, and LAND ON a QUINTET OF TOADS (one of which -- TREVOR -- belongs to NEVILLE LONGBOTTOM, who looks on with pride). ARGUS FILCH, Hogwarts' caretaker, stands grimly to the side as red-eyed MRS. NORRIS switches her tail at his feet. As the choir's song concludes, DUMBLEDORE rises, beaming over the sea of black hats.

dialogues.speaker: DUMBLEDORE
dialogues.text: Welcome! Welcome to another year at Hogwarts! I have a few things to say, before we become befuddled by our excellent feast. I myself am particularly looking forward to the flaming kiwi cups, which, while somewhat treacherous for those of us with facial hair... McGONAGALL clears her throat.

dialogues.speaker: DUMBLEDORE
dialogues.text: Mm. Yes. First, I'm pleased to welcome Professor R.J. Lupin, who has kindly consented to fill the post of Defense Against the Dark Arts. Good luck to you, Professor. Amid SCATTERED APPLAUSE, Harry, Ron, Hermione CLAP LOUDLY.

dialogues.speaker: HERMIONE
dialogues.text: Of course! That's why he knew to give you the chocolate, Harry.

dialogues.speaker: DUMBLEDORE
dialogues.text: As some of you may know, Professor Kettleburn, our Care of Magical Creatures teacher for many years, has decided to retire in order to spend more time with his remaining limbs. Fortunately, I'm delighted to announce that his place will be filled by none other than our own Rubeus Hagrid! (CONTINUED )

dialogues.speaker: CONTINUED
dialogues.text: Harry, Ron, and Hermione stare at each other -- stunned -- then APPLAUD vigorously. Hagrid turns ruby red, rises, and nearly topples the staff table, sending water goblets weaving.

dialogues.speaker: DUMBLEDORE
dialogues.text: (turning grave) Finally, on a more disquieting note, Hogwarts -- at the request of the Ministry of Magic -- will, until further notice, play host to the Dementors of Azkaban. A MURMUR of apprehension fills the hall. At the Slytherin table, DRACO MALFOY, flanked by the ever- present CRABBE and GOYLE, catches Harry's eye, feigns a dead faint.

dialogues.speaker: DUMBLEDORE
dialogues.text: The Dementors will be stationed at the entrances to the grounds. While they are under strict orders not to enter the castle itself, you will on occasion see them as you go about your daily activities. Under no circumstances are you to approach them. It is not in the nature of a Dementor to be forgiving.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Students exit the Great Hall, scale the Marble Staircase.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Harry, Ron and Hermione arrive at the seventh floor landing and approach the FAT LADY in the portrait.

dialogues.speaker: HARRY
dialogues.text: Fortuna Major.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The Gryffindors trail through the common room, the girls heading one way, boys the other.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: While those around him sleep, Harry takes the PHOTOGRAPH of his parents, sets it next to his bed, then glances around in quiet contentment. (CONTINUED)

dialogues.speaker: RON
dialogues.text: Good to be home, eh, Harry? Harry turns -- caught -- and finds Ron studying him from his own bed, Scabbers cradled in his hand. Harry nods and turns to the window..

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The Dementors drift to their positions outside the grounds.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Harry continues to stare.

dialogues.speaker: HARRY
dialogues.text: Yeah... As his breath CLOUDS THE GLASS, we gradually... FADE OUT.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: As BRIDGE and CASTLE glimmer in the distance, Hagrid emerges from the Forbidden Forest, dragging a fistful of dead FERRETS by the tail. A BIRD appears, circles his head playfully, CHIRP-CHIRP-CHIRPING merrily before it... ... flutters off, pin-wheeling past flowers, into a BIRDBATH, finally coming to rest upon... ++. an ANCIENT TREE. It TWITTERS cheerfully, singing its lovely song, when -- THWOCK! -- a branch punts the bird into the air. As feathers fly, the WHOMPING WILLOW resumes its shape.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Harry, Ron and Hermione sit on fat little pouffes ina murky, incense-laden room, along with Neville, Dean, Seamus, LAVENDER BROWN, PARVATI PATIL and others. (CONTINUED )

dialogues.speaker: PROFESSOR TRELAWNEY, (0.S.)
dialogues.text: Welcome, my children. In this room, you shall explore the mysterious art of Divination. In this room, you shall discover if you possess... A crimson scrim FLUTTERS and SYBIL TRELAWNEY, Divination Professor, glides dramatically INTO VIEW, eyes huge and bug-like behind enormous glasses.

dialogues.speaker: PROFESSOR TRELAWNEY
dialogues.text: ... the Sight. Hello. I am Professor Trelawney. Together, we shall cast ourselves into the future. But know this. One either has the Gift or not. It cannot be divined from the pages of a book. Books only cloud one's Inner Eye.

dialogues.speaker: HERMIONE, (0.S.)
dialogues.text: (under her breath) What rubbish. Ron spins. Frowns at Hermione.

dialogues.speaker: RON
dialogues.text: Where'd you come from?

dialogues.speaker: HERMIONE
dialogues.text: Me? I've been here all along.

dialogues.speaker: PROFESSOR TRELAWNEY
dialogues.text: (spinning on Neville) You, boy! Is your grandmother well?

dialogues.speaker: NEVILLE
dialogues.text: I... I think so.

dialogues.speaker: PROFESSOR TRELAWNEY
dialogues.text: I wouldn't be so sure of that. (continuing) The first term will be devoted to the reading of tea leaves. If all goes well, we will proceed to palmistry, fire omens, and finally... the crystal ball. (eyeing Parvati) By the way, dear, beware a red- haired man. (CONTINUED )

dialogues.speaker: CONTINUED
dialogues.text: Parvati eyes Ron dubiously. Edges her pouffe away.

dialogues.speaker: PROFESSOR TRELAWNEY
dialogues.text: Unfortunately, classes will be disrupted in February by a nasty bout of flu. I myself will lose my voice. And in late spring, one of our number will... leave us forever. As the class exchanges uneasy glances, Trelawney smiles brightly.

dialogues.speaker: PROFESSOR TRELAWNEY
dialogues.text: Well then. Shall we? cut TO:

dialogues.speaker: TEACUP
dialogues.text: Inside, a CLOUD of TEA LEAVES mutates oddly. Harry, sitting opposite Ron now, frowns at the leaves, consults the SYMBOLS in the textbook (Unfogging the Future) at his elbow. Trelawney walks amongst them, robes flowing.

dialogues.speaker: PROFESSOR TRELAWNEY
dialogues.text: Broaden your minds, my dears. And allow your eyes to see... beyond. Trelawney takes Lavender Brown's cup, peers inside.

dialogues.speaker: PROFESSOR TRELAWNEY
dialogues.text: A five-leaf clover... You can expect to wake with a horrible rash tomorrow morning, dear. (then, casually) Mr. Longbottom, after you've broken your first cup... CA-CHINK! Neville fumbles the cup in his hands and the brittle CRASH of CHINA is heard.

dialogues.speaker: PROFESSOR TRELAWNEY
dialogues.text: «+. would you be so kind as to select one of the blue ones? I'm rather partial to the pink. (pausing by Ron) What do you see in Mr. Potter's cup, Mr. Weasley? (CONTINUED )

dialogues.speaker: RON
dialogues.text: Well. He's got a wonky sort of cross -- that's trials and suffering. But this lot here could be the sun -- that's great happiness. So... he's going to suffer but be very happy about it. Professor Trelawney takes the cup, peers inside, and GASPS.

dialogues.speaker: PROFESSOR TRELAWNEY
dialogues.text: Ahhh!

dialogues.speaker: PARVATI
dialogues.text: What is it, Professor? Trelawney regards Harry with a mixture of pity and fear.

dialogues.speaker: PROFESSOR TRELAWNEY
dialogues.text: My dear boy... You have the Grim.

dialogues.speaker: SEAMUS
dialogues.text: The Grin? What's the Grin?

dialogues.speaker: PARVATI
dialogues.text: Not the grin, you idiot. The Grim.

dialogues.speaker: DEAN THOMAS
dialogues.text: But what does it mean, Professor?

dialogues.speaker: LAVENDER
dialogues.text: ‘The Grim...' All turn, see Lavender bent over her textbook.

dialogues.speaker: LAVENDER
dialogues.text: ‘Taking the form of a giant spectral dog, it is among the darkest omens in our world. It is an omen... of death.' Harry peers into his cup. The tea leaves shift. The dog disappears. And a new image emerges slowly... Sirius Black.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The trio emerge from the BRIDGE and make their way toward Hagrid's hut. The Whomping Willow looms in the distance. (CONTINUED )

dialogues.speaker: HERMIONE
dialogues.text: Death omens. Honestly. If you ask me, Divination's a very wooly discipline. Now Ancient Runes. That's a fascinating subject.

dialogues.speaker: RON
dialogues.text: Ancient Runes? Exactly how many classes are you taking this term?

dialogues.speaker: HERMIONE
dialogues.text: A fair few.

dialogues.speaker: RON
dialogues.text: Hang on. Ancient Runes is the same time as Divination. You'd have to be in two classes at once.

dialogues.speaker: HERMIONE
dialogues.text: Don't be silly. How could anyone be in two classes at once? (mimicking Trelawney) Broaden your minds...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: STUDENTS gather around Hagrid as Harry, Ron and Hermione arrive. Draco, Crabbe, and Goyle stand with the Slytherins.

dialogues.speaker: HAGRID
dialogues.text: C'mon now, get a move on! Got a real treat for yeh. Great lesson comin' up. Follow me.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Hagrid leads them toward a small paddock just this side of the Forbidden Forest. In the paddock, a freestanding IRON RACK hangs with DEAD FERRETS, BUZZING with FLIES. Nearby is a PUMPKIN PATCH.

dialogues.speaker: HAGRID
dialogues.text: Gather ‘round. Find yerself a spot. That's it. Now, firs' thing yeh'll want ter do is open yer books --

dialogues.speaker: DRACO
dialogues.text: And exactly how do we do that? (CONTINUED )

dialogues.speaker: CONTINUED
dialogues.text: Hagrid looks. Belts, rope, Spellotape: any means available have been employed to bridle The Monster Book of Monsters, which QUIVER VIOLENTLY.

dialogues.speaker: HAGRID
dialogues.text: Crikey. Didn' yeh know? All yeh've got ter do is stroke 'em. Look -- Hagrid takes Hermione's copy, SNAPS the Spellotape binding it. As it begins to BITE, Hagrid calmly runs a forefinger down the book's spine and it... SHIVERS. Falls quietly open. Hagrid glances at the class, looking suddenly unsure.

dialogues.speaker: HAGRID
dialogues.text: Righ' then. So... so... yeh've got yer books, an' now yeh need the Magical Creatures. Right. So... I'll... I'1l go an' get ‘em. Hagrid turns, disappears into the trees. Draco shakes his head, SPEAKS LOUDLY to Crabbe and Goyle.

dialogues.speaker: DRACO
dialogues.text: God, this place is going to the dogs. Wait until my father hears Dumbledore's got this oaf teaching classes.

dialogues.speaker: HARRY
dialogues.text: Listen, you stupid prat -- Eyes WIDENING in fear, Malfoy steps back, points.

dialogues.speaker: DRACO
dialogues.text: Potter, there's a Dementor behind you. Harry JUMPS, wheels in fear, finds... nothing. Instantly, the SLYTHERINS make an eerie OOH... and OOH sound, then break up laughing. Harry reddens, embarrassed, then... A STRANGE BEAST (BUCKBEAK) emerges from the trees. It has the torso, hind legs, and tail of a horse, but the front legs, wings and head of a giant eagle. The students step back in fear, then Hagrid appears, shooing the beast on.

dialogues.speaker: HAGRID
dialogues.text: Gee up, there! (grinning) Beau'iful, isn' he? (CONTINUED )

dialogues.speaker: CONTINUED
dialogues.text: There seems no consensus on this, but the students stare in wary wonder nonetheless. As Hagrid coaxes the beast to the center of the paddock, Ron stares uneasily.

dialogues.speaker: RON
dialogues.text: Hagrid. Exactly what is that?

dialogues.speaker: HAGRID
dialogues.text: A Hippogriff, o' course. Now, firs' thing yeh gotta know is they're proud. Easily offended, Hippogriffs are. Don't never insult one, ‘cause it migh' be the las' thing yeh do. Right then -- who wants ter come an' say hello? The entire class STEPS BACK, leaving Harry in front.

dialogues.speaker: HAGRID
dialogues.text: Good man, Harry! Harry looks around, then -- reluctantly -- approaches.

dialogues.speaker: HAGRID
dialogues.text: Tha's it. Easy now... stop! This here's Buckbeak, Harry. Yeh want ter let ‘im make the firs' move. It's polite, see? Jus' take step forward, give ‘im a bow, and if Buckbeak bows back, yeh're allowed ter touch him. Ready? Unsure, Harry nods anyway. Steps forward. And... bows. Buckbeak's head cocks, eagle eyes studying Harry cannily. Harry waits. And waits...

dialogues.speaker: HAGRID
dialogues.text: Back off, Harry! Back off! Harry starts to step back, when... Buckbeak ducks his beak. Hagrid sighs, relieved.

dialogues.speaker: HAGRID
dialogues.text: Well done, Harry! Go on. Give ‘im a pat. Tentatively, Harry reaches out, lays his hand on Buckbeak's fierce beak. The class CLAPS. Harry smiles. (CONTINUED )

dialogues.speaker: HAGRID
dialogues.text: Look at that! I reckon he migh' let yeh ride ‘im!

dialogues.speaker: HARRY
dialogues.text: (smile drooping) Excuse me?

dialogues.speaker: HAGRID
dialogues.text: We'll jus' set yeh behind the wing joint. Mind yeh don' pull any feathers out. He won' like that. Hagrid lifts Harry high, drops him onto Buckbeak's back, and before Harry's settled, SLAPS Buckbeak's hindquarters.

dialogues.speaker: HAGRID
dialogues.text: Off yeh go! As Buckbeak GALLOPS FORWARD, Harry slides scarily back, giant WINGS unfold, huge and powerful, and -- WHOOSH! -- they SOAR into the air. Rising higher. And higher. And higher. Gradually, Harry loosens his hold on Buckbeak's neck. Losing himself in the joy of flying. Smiling at the sight of his and Buckbeak's SHADOW racing across the grass below. Circling over the Whomping Willow, past Hogwarts castle, and then SWOOPING, with heart-stopping speed, over the Black Lake, Buckbeak's talons tickling the smooth glass of the water, summoning the GIANT SQUID to the surface briefly. Hagrid WHISTLES then, and Buckbeak wheels, beating his way back to the paddock, galloping to a halt. As Harry slides off, the class CHEERS -- all except Draco, who narrows his eyes maliciously.

dialogues.speaker: HAGRID
dialogues.text: Good work, Harry! (under his breath) How'm I doin' me firs' day?

dialogues.speaker: HARRY
dialogues.text: Brilliant... Professor. They both grin, when Draco pushes past them roughly, strides toward Buckbeak. (CONTINUED )

dialogues.speaker: DRACO
dialogues.text: Give me a go at that thing. If Potter can do it, it must be easy. You're not dangerous at all, are you, you great ugly brute --

dialogues.speaker: HAGRID
dialogues.text: Malfoy! No! In a flash, Buckbeak's steely talons SLASH DOWN. Malfoy freezes. Looks down at the BLOOD BLOSSOMING on his robes. SHRIEKS. Instantly, Harry dashes forward. Buckbeak WHIPS AROUND, raises its talons and -- seeing Harry -- lowers them. Ducks its beak. Harry... realizing what he's done... breathes.

dialogues.speaker: DRACO
dialogues.text: It's killed me! It's killed me!

dialogues.speaker: HAGRID
dialogues.text: Calm yerself! Yer fine... jus' a scratch... Hagrid looks: a DEEP GASH glistens on Draco's limp arm.

dialogues.speaker: HERMIONE
dialogues.text: Hagrid. He's got to be taken to a hospital. I'11 go with you, if you like --

dialogues.speaker: HAGRID
dialogues.text: No. I'm the teacher. You all... you all just... Class dismissed! And with that, Hagrid -- looking shaken -- swoops up Malfoy, flops him over his shoulder, and lumbers toward the castle.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: As Lavender and Parvati huddle over a DOZEN TEACUPS, Avidly interpreting patterns in HUSHED VOICES, Draco, arm bound in a SLING, holds court before a clot of Slytherins.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Does it hurt terribly, Draco? (CONTINUED )

dialogues.speaker: DRACO
dialogues.text: (a tad theatrical) It comes and goes. Still... I consider myself lucky. According to Madam Pomfrey, another minute or two... and I could've lost the arm. Harry, Ron and Hermione watch from the Gryffindor table.

dialogues.speaker: RON
dialogues.text: The little git. He's really laying it on thick, isn't he?

dialogues.speaker: HARRY
dialogues.text: At least Hagrid didn't get sacked.

dialogues.speaker: HERMIONE
dialogues.text: Yes. But I hear Draco's father's furious. I don't think we've heard the end of this...

dialogues.speaker: SEAMUS
dialogues.text: He's been sighted! They turn. Seamus and the other Gryffindors are huddled over a copy of The Daily Prophet.

dialogues.speaker: RON
dialogues.text: Who? But the PHOTOGRAPH on the Prophet's front page provides a chilling answer: Sirius Black. Hermione reads over the shoulders of others. WHISPERS half to herself:

dialogues.speaker: HERMIONE
dialogues.text: Achintee? That's not far from here...

dialogues.speaker: NEVILLE
dialogues.text: You don't think he'd come to Hogwarts, do you?

dialogues.speaker: LAVENDER
dialogues.text: With the Dementors at every entrance?

dialogues.speaker: LAVENDAR
dialogues.text: Dementors? He's already slipped by them once, hasn't he? Who's to say he can't do it again? (CONTINUED )

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: As a flicker of fear passes through Harry's face, BEM, a Nigerian boy, stares grimly at the grainy image of Black.

dialogues.speaker: BEM
dialogues.text: That's right. Black could be anywhere. It's like trying to catch smoke. Like trying to catch smoke with your bare hands.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Beautiful flowers gleam in the dawn light, then, slowly begin to WITHER. The dew FREEZES, the grass grows brittle. Seconds later, the Dementors sweep by.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: A tall WARDROBE RATTLES VIOLENTLY as Harry, Ron and several classmates regard it warily.

dialogues.speaker: PROFESSOR LUPIN
dialogues.text: Intriguing, yes? Would anyone like to venture a guess as to what's inside?

dialogues.speaker: SEAMUS
dialogues.text: (in a hushed voice) That's a Boggart, that is.

dialogues.speaker: PROFESSOR LUPIN
dialogues.text: Very good, Mr. Finnigan. Can anyone tell us what a Boggart looks like?

dialogues.speaker: HERMIONE
dialogues.text: No one knows. Ron JUMPS, glances at Hermione, then WHISPERS to Harry.

dialogues.speaker: RON
dialogues.text: When'd she get here? (CONTINUED )

dialogues.speaker: CONTINUED
dialogues.text: queasily. 38. 49

dialogues.speaker: HERMIONE
dialogues.text: Boggarts are shape-shifters. They take the shape of whatever a particular person fears most. That's what makes it so --

dialogues.speaker: PROFESSOR LUPIN
dialogues.text: Terrifying, yes. Luckily, a very simple charm exists to repel a Boggart. Let's practice it now, shall we? Without wands, please... Riddikulus!

dialogues.speaker: STUDENTS
dialogues.text: Riddikulus!

dialogues.speaker: DRACO
dialogues.text: (muttering softly) It's this class that's ridiculous.

dialogues.speaker: PROFESSOR LUPIN
dialogues.text: Good. So much for the easy part. You see, the incantation alone is not enough. What really finishes a Boggart off is... laughter. You need to force it to assume a shape you find truly amusing. Neville, come up here, will you? Neville eyes the rattling wardrobe, steps forward

dialogues.speaker: PROFESSOR LUPIN
dialogues.text: What would you say is the thing that frightens you most?

dialogues.speaker: NEVILLE
dialogues.text: Profter... Snafpt...

dialogues.speaker: PROFESSOR LUPIN
dialogues.text: Didn't catch that, Neville, sorry.

dialogues.speaker: NEVILLE
dialogues.text: Professor Snape. Everyone LAUGHS good-naturedly. Lupin nods thoughtfully.

dialogues.speaker: PROFESSOR LUPIN
dialogues.text: Hmmm... yes. Neville, I believe you live with your grandmother? (CONTINUED )

dialogues.speaker: NEVILLE
dialogues.text: Yes, but I don't want the Boggart to turn into her either.

dialogues.speaker: PROFESSOR LUPIN
dialogues.text: It won't. But I want you to picture her clothes, only her clothes, very clearly in your mind. Can you do that?

dialogues.speaker: NEVILLE
dialogues.text: (closing his eyes) She carries a red handbag...

dialogues.speaker: PROFESSOR LUPIN
dialogues.text: That's fine. We don't need to hear it. If you see it, we will. Now, when I open this wardrobe, Neville, here's what I want you to do... Lupin leans close to Neville, WHISPERS. Neville's eyes POP OPEN in shock. Consider Lupin uncertainly.

dialogues.speaker: PROFESSOR LUPIN
dialogues.text: You can do this, Neville. Neville nods nervously, takes a deep breath.

dialogues.speaker: PROFESSOR LUPIN
dialogues.text: Right then. Wand at the ready. One. Two. Three! SPARKS jet from Lupin's wand, strike the doorknob, and the wardrobe BURSTS OPEN. Instantly, Snape appears, eyes flashing hideously as he stalks forward. Neville backs away in fright.

dialogues.speaker: PROFESSOR LUPIN
dialogues.text: Think, Neville. Think!

dialogues.speaker: NEVILLE
dialogues.text: R-r-riddikulus! CRACK! Snape stumbles in a FLASH OF LIGHT and reappears... in a LONG, LACE-TRIMMED DRESS, TOWERING MOTH-EATEN HAT, and CRIMSON HANDBAG. Instantly, the class ROARS (except for Draco and his fellow Slytherins). Neville blinks, amazed, then slowly, grins himself. Lupin drops the needle on an OLD GRAMAPHONE. As a SCRATCHY RHUMBA fills the room, he points to Ron. (CONTINUED )

dialogues.speaker: PROFESSOR LUPIN
dialogues.text: Ron! Forward! Snape DISSOLVES into a mad whirling mass, then mutates into a... GIANT SPIDER. As Ron GASPS, Harry and Hermione exchange an uncertain glance. Lupin puts his hands on Ron's shoulders to steady him. Ron raises his wand.

dialogues.speaker: RON
dialogues.text: Riddikulus! CRACK! ROLLER SKATES materialize on the spider's hairy feet and it begins to shuffle crazily in place. Instantly, Ron relaxes as the class' LAUGHTER rings out.

dialogues.speaker: PROFESSOR LUPIN
dialogues.text: Parvati! As Parvati steps up, the spider SPINS faster and faster, a DIZZYING BLUR, then reappears as a VAMPIRE.

dialogues.speaker: PARVATI
dialogues.text: Riddikulus! As the vampire WHIPS its cloak across its eyes, we CUT BEHIND... so our POV is of the students. SWISH! The cloak reopens, the class LAUGHS, and we REVERSE again... see that the vampire is now dressed like CARMEN MIRANDA. As it begins to SHIMMY about -- against its will -- the class starts to CLAP.

dialogues.speaker: PROFESSOR LUPIN
dialogues.text: Mr. Thomas! As Dean steps up, the vampire's undulating body attenuates, its skin darkening with diamond-thatched SCALES becoming... a GIANT COBRA.

dialogues.speaker: DEAN THOMAS
dialogues.text: Riddikulus! The cobra's hooded head BOBS back and forth, transforms into a JACK-IN-THE-BOX. Lupin grins and...

dialogues.speaker: PROFESSOR LUPIN
dialogues.text: Next! ... turns, sees Harry step forward expectantly. Concern flickers through Lupin's face. The Jack-In-The-Box pivots on its spring, its face tumbling toward Harry, becoming more sinister, transforming into a... (CONTINUED )

dialogues.speaker: CONTINUED
dialogues.text: ... Dementor. Suddenly the MUSIC FADES. Harry starts to raise his wand, then... freezes, transfixed. The Dementor looms closer and closer, when... ... Lupin steps between, snaps his wand.

dialogues.speaker: PROFESSOR LUPIN
dialogues.text: Here! CRACK! -- the Dementor vanishes and a ROILING MIST appears, which becomes CLOUDS. Something glows within the clouds, white, silvery and round...

dialogues.speaker: PROFESSOR LUPIN
dialogues.text: Riddikulus! POP! The orb deflates like a punctured balloon, WHIZZES crazily about the room, then darts back into the wardrobe. The door SLAMS SHUT and the CLASS CHEERS.

dialogues.speaker: PROFESSOR LUPIN
dialogues.text: Well done, everyone. I think that's enough excitement for today. As the students exit, chattering loudly, only Harry, subdued, remains behind. At the doorway, Lupin glances back, exchanges a private glance with him. As he exits, the WARDROBE gives one last RATTLE.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: A great buzzing queue of STUDENTS -- Third Years and older -- each clutching a PERMISSION FORM -- pass by a glowering Filch. PROFESSOR McGONAGALL Remember! These visits to Hogsmeade Village are a privilege. Should your behavior reflect poorly on the school in any way, that privilege shall not be extended again. Harry approaches her, but before he can utter a syllable: PROFESSOR McGONAGALL No permission form. No visiting the Village. That's the rule, Potter. (CONTINUED )

dialogues.speaker: HARRY
dialogues.text: Yes, Professor, but I thought if you said I could go -- PROFESSOR McGONAGALL But I don't say so. A parent or guardian must sign, and since I am neither, it would be inappropriate. (a flicker of pity) I'm sorry, Potter. But that's my final word. Ron and Hermione -- watching Harry expectantly from across the way -- see him turn, shake his head. Their faces fall. Harry raises his hand in farewell. Watches them go.

dialogues.speaker: PROFESSOR LUPIN, (0.S.)
dialogues.text: So. No Hogsmeade, eh ?

dialogues.speaker: OMITTED 51
dialogues.text: thru 54

dialogues.speaker: LATER
dialogues.text: Deep in the distance, some BOYS skate about on brooms, tossing a RAGGED QUAFFLE back and forth. CAMERA TILTS. FINDS Harry and Lupin walking along the bridge.

dialogues.speaker: PROFESSOR LUPIN
dialogues.text: Well, don't feel too bad. I was roundly disappointed the first time I went.

dialogues.speaker: HARRY
dialogues.text: Really?

dialogues.speaker: PROFESSOR LUPIN
dialogues.text: No. I was just trying to make you feel better. Honeydukes' sweets are the best in the world. Their Pepper Imps are so strong you smoke at the ears. And Zonko's Joke Shop may be dangerous, but you can't beat their Stink Pellets. (CONTINUED )

dialogues.speaker: HARRY
dialogues.text: (nodding glumly) Not to mention The Shrieking Shack, which, according to Hermione, is the most severely haunted building in Britain.

dialogues.speaker: PROFESSOR LUPIN
dialogues.text: Yes, that too...

dialogues.speaker: HARRY
dialogues.text: Professor, can I ask you something?

dialogues.speaker: PROFESSOR LUPIN
dialogues.text: You'd like to know why I stopped you from facing the Boggart. (off Harry's surprise) I should think it'd be obvious. I assumed the Boggart would take the shape of Lord Voldemort. Harry frowns. Lupin studies him curiously.

dialogues.speaker: PROFESSOR LUPIN
dialogues.text: But clearly... I was wrong.

dialogues.speaker: HARRY
dialogues.text: I did think of Voldemort first. But then, I remembered that night on the train... and the Dementors... (CONTINUED)

dialogues.speaker: PROFESSOR LUPIN
dialogues.text: Well, well. I'm impressed. That suggests that what you fear most of all is... fear. Very wise.

dialogues.speaker: HARRY
dialogues.text: Before I fainted... I heard something. A woman. Screaming.

dialogues.speaker: PROFESSOR LUPIN
dialogues.text: Dementors force us to relive the worst memories of our lives. Our pain becomes their power.

dialogues.speaker: HARRY
dialogues.text: I think it was my mother. The night she was murdered. Harry looks up. Finds Lupin studying him. (CONTINUED )

dialogues.speaker: PROFESSOR LUPIN
dialogues.text: The first time I saw you, Harry, I recognized you immediately. Not by your scar. By your eyes. They're your mother Lily's. (nodding) Yes. I knew her. She was there for me at a time when no one else was. We used to talk for hours. She was not only a singularly gifted witch but an uncommonly kind woman. She had a way of seeing the beauty in whoever she met, even -- and perhaps most especially -- when that person couldn't see it in themselves... Lupin's eyes glaze in memory, then he blinks, smiles.

dialogues.speaker: PROFESSOR LUPIN
dialogues.text: Which perhaps explains her affection for your father. James had, shall we say, a certain talent for trouble. A gift, rumor has it, he passed on to you. Lupin turns, eyes Harry affectionately. Harry smiles vaguely.

dialogues.speaker: PROFESSOR LUPIN
dialogues.text: I could tell you stories -- and there are many about your parents, Harry -- but know this... (eyeing Harry intensely) They lived. Every moment of every day. You should know that. That's how they'd want to be remembered.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The Hall buzzes with tales of Hogsmeade, as students swap stories, sample sweets, and send SOAP BUBBLES of all shapes, sizes and colors into the air. A MARIONETTE of a HARLEQUIN cavorts atop the Gryffindor table, moving its limbs in response to the STRANDS of LIGHT that extend from Neville's fingertips. Seamus passes his hand through the light beams and -- FLUMPH! -- the Harlequin collapses. (CONTINUED )

dialogues.speaker: HERMIONE
dialogues.text: And the post office! It's about 200 owls, all sitting on color- coded shelves, depending on how fast you want your letter to go!

dialogues.speaker: RON
dialogues.text: And Honeyduke's is brilliant! Sugar Quills, Flaming Whizbees -- and blood-flavored lollipops for Halloween! Harry nods, picking quietly through the spray of brilliantly colored sweets on the table. Hermione notices.

dialogues.speaker: HERMIONE
dialogues.text: But, I mean, after awhile, it got a bit boring. Don't you think, Ron?

dialogues.speaker: RON
dialogues.text: Huh? Oh. Yeah. Dead depressing. Hang on. I almost forgot. I got you something wicked at Dervish and Banges. It's a Pocket Sneakoscope. Ron places a SMALL GLASS SPINNING TOP on the table.

dialogues.speaker: RON
dialogues.text: If there's someone untrustworthy around, it's meant to light up and spin. Mind you, Fred and George say it's rubbish, sold for wizard tourists, but I thought, you know, it can't hurt, given that...

dialogues.speaker: HARRY
dialogues.text: Sirius Black's trying to kill me. Harry looks up, GRINS at the two of them.

dialogues.speaker: HARRY
dialogues.text: I'm glad you had a good time. Really. And thanks for this. (eyeing the Sneakoscope) Rubbish or not, you're right. It can't hurt. With that, Harry pops a PEPPER IMP into his mouth. (CONTINUED )

dialogues.speaker: RON
dialogues.text: Oh, careful of those, they'll make your... On cue, SMOKE CURLS from Harry's ears and nose.

dialogues.speaker: RON
dialogues.text: Never mind.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (LATER)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: As Harry, Ron, and Hermione climb the stairs, they find a crowd gathering on the Seventh Floor landing.

dialogues.speaker: RON
dialogues.text: What's the hold-up? Only Neville ever forgets the password.

dialogues.speaker: PERCY
dialogues.text: (pushing past) Let me through, please. Excuse me, thank you, I'm Head Boy... (stopping dead) Back! All of you! No one is to enter this dormitory until it has been fully searched! Harry, Ron, and Hermione exchange dark glances, when... Ginny emerges from the crowd, her face ashen.

dialogues.speaker: GINNY
dialogues.text: The Fat Lady... she's gone.

dialogues.speaker: RON
dialogues.text: Probably stuffing her face with the apples in that still life on the second floor again.

dialogues.speaker: GINNY
dialogues.text: No. You don't understand -- Hermione GASPS. GRABS Harry's arm. He looks. SEES: The Fat Lady's portrait has been SLASHED VICIOUSLY, great strips of canvas hanging from the frame. Just then, Dumbledore appears.

dialogues.speaker: DUMBLEDORE
dialogues.text: Mr. Filch. Round up the ghosts. Tell them to search every painting in the castle for the Fat Lady. (CONTINUED )

dialogues.speaker: CONTINUED
dialogues.text: Just then, there is a SCREAM. The students dash to the landing, where all THE PAINTINGS WHISPER FEARFULLY. Filch's rheumy eyes peer up, searching the upper shadows, then... narrow.

dialogues.speaker: FILCH
dialogues.text: There'll be no need for ghosts, Professor... Filch extends a crooked finger. High up, near the ceiling, the Fat Lady cowers in a portrait not her own, trembling.

dialogues.speaker: DUMBLEDORE
dialogues.text: Dear lady. Who did this to you?

dialogues.speaker: FAT LADY
dialogues.text: (in a trance) Eyes like the devil he's got. And a soul as dark as his name. It was him, Headmaster. The one they talk about. He's here. Somewhere in the castle. Sirius Black. As the students REACT, Dumbledore's VOICE cuts through.

dialogues.speaker: DUMBLEDORE
dialogues.text: Secure the castle, Mr. Filch. The rest of you... to the Great Hall.

dialogues.speaker: SECURING THE CASTLE
dialogues.text: CLOCK TOWER DOOR: Great GROANING TUMBLERS fall. SPINDLES rotate. CYLINDERS -- one after another -- fire into place. WINDOWS: Iron SPIKES, sharp as razors, rise instantly.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: One by one, deep in the distance, the LIGHTS of the Great Hall go out. Dementors appear, COVERING FRAME, then separate like a curtain...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: CAMERA DRIFTS THROUGH the silent room, OVER an ocean of SLEEPING BAGS, FINDS Harry lying awake, staring at the net of stars glimmering beyond the highest window. (CONTINUED )
61 A gentle CREAK is heard and Harry's eyes shift, see Snape pass through the great doors, converge with Dumbledore.

dialogues.speaker: SNAPE
dialogues.text: I've done the dungeons, Headmaster. No sign of Black. Nor anywhere else in the castle.

dialogues.speaker: DUMBLEDORE
dialogues.text: (nodding) I didn't really expect him to linger.

dialogues.speaker: SNAPE
dialogues.text: Remarkable feat, don't you think? To enter Hogwarts castle on one's own, completely undetected... Dumbledore gazes at the students, refusing to take the bait.

dialogues.speaker: SNAPE
dialogues.text: You may recall, prior to the start of term, I did express my concerns when you appointed Professor --

dialogues.speaker: DUMBLEDORE
dialogues.text: I do not believe a single professor inside this castle would have helped Sirius Black enter it, Severus. As Snape's eyes glitter darkly, Dumbledore gazes out over the slumbering students.

dialogues.speaker: DUMBLEDORE
dialogues.text: No... I feel quite confident the castle is safe. And I'm more than willing to let the students return to their Houses. But tomorrow. For now, let them sleep... As Dumbledore's gaze finds Harry, he shuts his eyes, feigns sleep.

dialogues.speaker: DUMBLEDORE
dialogues.text: It's astonishing what the body can endure when the mind allows itself to rest.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The Whomping Willow idly casts off a few withering leaves. 62 (CONTINUED )

dialogues.speaker: SIR CADOGAN, (V.O.)
dialogues.text: What villains are these that trespass upon my private lands!

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The Fat Lady has been replaced by a PAINTING of a TINY KNIGHT (SIR CADOGAN). Stalking a bare stretch of grass as his PONY grazes nearby, he brandishes his sword wildly as a group of Gryffindors regard him warily.

dialogues.speaker: SIR CADOGAN
dialogues.text: Who dares challenge Sir Cadogan! Back, you scurvy braggarts! You rogues!

dialogues.speaker: SEAMUS
dialogues.text: He's barking mad!

dialogues.speaker: DEAN THOMAS
dialogues.text: What d'you expect? After what happened to the Fat Lady, none of the other pictures would take the job.

dialogues.speaker: NEVILLE
dialogues.text: But he keeps changing the password. Twice just this morning! I've taken to keeping a list. As Neville holds up a wrinkled piece of parchment, Harry, Ron and Hermione begin to exit.

dialogues.speaker: SIR CADOGAN
dialogues.text: Farewell, comrades! If ever you have need of noble heart and steely sinew, call upon Sir Cadogan!

dialogues.speaker: RON
dialogues.text: Yeah, we'll call you... if we ever need someone mental.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: SNAP! Snape PULLS DOWN a SCREEN over the blackboard, turns. (CONTINUED )

dialogues.speaker: SNAPE
dialogues.text: Turn to page 394. As the students eye Snape with guarded curiosity, Malfoy finishes SCRAWLING something on a bit of PARCHMENT and balls it up in his hands. As he opens them, a MOTH flutters from his palms.

dialogues.speaker: HARRY
dialogues.text: Excuse me, sir, but... where's Professor Lupin?

dialogues.speaker: SNAPE
dialogues.text: That's not really your concern, is it, Potter? Suffice it to say, your Professor finds himself incapable of teaching at the present time. Page 394. Snape waves the MOTH away, blows out a candle and a SLIDE SHOW BEGINS. An ANCIENT WOODCUT of a HORRIFIC BEAST flickers at the front of the room. Ron frowns down at his book.

dialogues.speaker: RON
dialogues.text: Werewolves?

dialogues.speaker: HERMIONE
dialogues.text: But, sir, we've only just begun learning about Red Caps and Hinkypunks. We're not meant to start nocturnal beasts for weeks --

dialogues.speaker: SNAPE
dialogues.text: Quiet!

dialogues.speaker: RON
dialogues.text: (to Harry) When did she come in? Did you see her come in...

dialogues.speaker: SNAPE
dialogues.text: Now. Which of you can tell me the difference between an Animagus and a werewolf? As the class stares mutely at a SLIDE of an ATTACKING WEREWOLF, Hermione waiting desperately for someone to respond to Snape's question, the moth flutters by Harry. (CONTINUED )

dialogues.speaker: CONTINUED
dialogues.text: SWAT! He pins it to his desk. A tiny cloud of moth dust mushrooms into the air and Harry lifts his palm. Malfoy's PARCHMENT has reappeared.

dialogues.speaker: SNAPE
dialogues.text: No one? How... disappointing.

dialogues.speaker: HERMIONE
dialogues.text: Please, sir, an Animagus is a wizard who elects to turn into an animal. A werewolf has no choice in the matter. Furthermore, the werewolf actively hunts humans and responds only to the call of its own kind -- Malfoy lets out a LOW HOWL.

dialogues.speaker: SNAPE
dialogues.text: Quiet, Malfoy! Though one must admit to feeling your pain. That is the second time you have spoken out of turn, Miss Granger. Tell me. Are you incapable of restraining yourself? Or do you take pride in being an insufferable know-it-all?

dialogues.speaker: RON
dialogues.text: (to Harry) He's got a point, you know. Harry stares at the parchment. Malfoy has drawn a crude caricature of Harry in his Quidditch robes being STRUCK BY LIGHTNING over and over.

dialogues.speaker: SNAPE
dialogues.text: Five points from Gryffindor! (to the class) As a antidote to your ignorance, I prescribe two rolls of parchment on the werewolf by Monday morning, with particular emphasis placed on recognizing it. (suddenly) Passing notes, Potter? Snape SNATCHES the drawing from under Harry's nose. Eyes it.

dialogues.speaker: SNAPE
dialogues.text: Not exactly Picasso, are you? I hope you demonstrate more talent on the Quidditch pitch this weekend then you do as an artist. (MORE ) (CONTINUED )

dialogues.speaker: SNAPE, (CONT'D)
dialogues.text: If not, I fear you'll perish, given the weather forecast. Until that time, however, you'll forgive me if I don't let you off homework. Should you die, I assure you... you need not hand it in. As Snape turns away, Malfoy sniggers with Crabbe, Coyle and PIKE. Harry glances down at the drawing once more and we hear a true RUMBLE of THUNDER and -- cut TO: ++. a STITCH OF LIGHTNING...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: as it strikes one of the GOLDEN QUIDDITCH RINGS and the clouds bloom with ICY BLUE light. Far below, in the stands, RAIN lashes the SEA OF UMBRELLAS. As one flies free, soaring end over end into the sky, the... -+. CROWD EXPLODES and two Quidditch squads -- Gryffindor in SCARLET, Hufflepuff in CANARY-YELLOW -- shoot into the air. Twin BLUDGERS FIRE skyward, and the match is on. We CUT INTO Harry, rising like a rocket through the mist, his robes SNAPPING VIOLENTLY in the wind.

dialogues.speaker: HARRY'S POV
dialogues.text: -- as he flies, RAIN falling like NEEDLES before him, every dark cloud concealing potential danger. Beaters crisscross his path. A BLUDGER WHIZZES past, then a second ROCKETS DIRECTLY AT HIM. SWOOP! -- Harry ducks, watches the BLUDGER SHATTER the BROOM of a HUFFLEPUFF BEATER. The Beater goes into a wild spiral, vanishes in the mist. (CONTINUED )

dialogues.speaker: IN THE STANDS
dialogues.text: Ron squints upward, the players little more than STREAKING BLURS from his vantage. KA-SSSST! A STITCH OF LIGHTNING strikes the TAIL of ANGELINA JOHNSON'S broom. As it BURSTS into FLAMES, she PLUMMETS to the pitch. Ron looks down at his own HAND. In the HIGHLY-CHARGED AIR, the HAIR above his knuckles RISES. In the sky, Harry flies fearlessly, searching for the Snitch as Bludgers pierce the clouds above him and CHASERS flit IN and OUT OF VIEW far below. Suddenly, in the stands opposite, a BLACK UMBRELLA flies from the hand of a RAVENCLAW GIRL. For a moment, it sails wondrously through the heavy air, a Magritte dream, then -- WHOOP! WHOOP! WHOOP! -- abruptly picks up speed, ROTATING LIKE A HATCHET. Harry DUCKS, turns, and watches it disappear into a bank of clouds. Then... -+. something GLIMMERS: the Snitch. Instantly, Harry jets off closing fast on the tiny, glimmering ball, chasing it through one cloud... then another... and another... until... .-. he BREAKS into a clear patch of sky... only to find the Snitch is gone. Angrily, Harry whips the Nimbus back around, searching the horizon frantically, when he spies something: In the stadium's HIGHEST TOWER, something ENORMOUS flickers briefly in SILHOUETTE, then is obscured by a veil of mist. Harry turns. In the distance, the stray umbrella spins INTO VIEW, harpoons a player. Harry's eyes shift. The SNITCH SHIMMERS like a FIREFLY in the dark underbelly of a cloud. Harry begins to go... when the veil of mist shrouding the high tower shifts and -- for one brief moment -- a GREAT DOG is revealed. As this mist closes, Harry frowns, jets away. As Harry pelts after the Snitch, the crowd RISES TO THEIR FEET, ROARING. Ron GRINS over the binoculars, watching Harry shred the mist as he urges his broom on.

dialogues.speaker: HARRY
dialogues.text: Come on! Faster! The trace of a smile forms on Harry's lips as he closes on the Snitch... only yards away... reaching out... when... (CONTINUED )

dialogues.speaker: CONTINUED
dialogues.text: -.. a THIN GLAZE of ICE clouds his GLASSES. He wipes at them, then flinches: BLOOD trickles down his cheek. The rain is turning to needles. Needles of ice. Harry glances at the HANDLE of his BROOMSTICK. The water sluicing through the grain is FREEZING. VAPOR streams from his mouth and nose. SWOOSH! A dark SILHOUETTE passes on his right. He turns. SWOOSH! -- a twin SILHOUETTE passes on his left. Harry sees neither. Looks down. The layers of mist are parting below. LIGHTNING STRIKES. Reveals: an ARMY OF SILHOUETTES drifting onto the pitch. A vast legion of them... DEMENTORS. A DISTANT WHISTLE weaves into the WIND, rises in pitch, not a whistle at all, but a... SCREAM. A WOMAN'S SCREAM. Harry's eyes flutter, and wisps of SILVERY WHITE LIGHT float from his mouth. His glasses glaze over completely. His fingers, rigid, can no longer grip the broom and... He FALLS.

dialogues.speaker: HERMIONE
dialogues.text: No!!! Harry and broom tumble in opposite directions. The Nimbus soars end over end, tossed by the currents, then drops... right into the Whomping Willow. FLOOMPH! Harry, in freefall, drops through one cloud, then another. Plummeting through the circling Dementors. Then... a TALL FIGURE rises from the crowd. Raises an OPEN HAND to the heavens. Eyes angry but clear. Dumbledore. An EXPLOSION -- more powerful than thunder -- rocks the air. A FLASH -- more fierce than lightning -- shocks the sky. And then... THE SCREEN GOES BLACK. Not a sound. For the longest time. Then... VOICES:

dialogues.speaker: RON
dialogues.text: Looks a bit peaky, doesn't he? (CONTINUED )

dialogues.speaker: FRED
dialogues.text: Peaky? What d'you expect him to look like? He fell fifty feet.

dialogues.speaker: GEORGE
dialogues.text: Yeah, c'mon, Ron. We'll walk you off the Astronomy Tower and see how you come out looking.

dialogues.speaker: HARRY
dialogues.text: Probably a right sight better than he normally does. Harry opens his eyes and Ron, Fred, George, and Hermione SLOWLY COME INTO FOCUS, standing at the foot of his bed in the hospital wing.

dialogues.speaker: HERMIONE
dialogues.text: Harry! How're you feeling?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: As Harry edges up against his pillow, we see a NURSE in the b.g., removing the SPOKES of an umbrella froma Hufflepuff player's neck. Harry doesn't look so good himself.

dialogues.speaker: HARRY
dialogues.text: Brilliant.

dialogues.speaker: FRED
dialogues.text: Gave us a right good scare, mate.

dialogues.speaker: HARRY
dialogues.text: What happened?

dialogues.speaker: RON
dialogues.text: You fell off your broom.

dialogues.speaker: HARRY
dialogues.text: Really? I meant the match. Who won? Silence. Uncomfortable glances.

dialogues.speaker: HERMIONE
dialogues.text: No one blames you, Harry. The Dementors aren't meant to come on the grounds. Dumbledore was furious. After he saved you, he sent them straight off. (CONTINUED )

dialogues.speaker: CONTINUED
dialogues.text: Harry nods grimly, stares at the RAIN LASHING the window.

dialogues.speaker: RON
dialogues.text: There's something else you should know, Harry. Your Nimbus -- when it blew away? -- it sort of landed in the Whomping Willow. And well... He tips a BAG of SPLINTERED WOOD and TWISTED TWIGS onto the bed. As Harry stares, we hear a gentle WIND, then...

dialogues.speaker: PROFESSOR LUPIN, (V.O.)
dialogues.text: I'm sorry about your broom, Harry. There's no chance of fixing it?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Harry shakes his head in response to Lupin's question, then -- WHOOSH! -- sets Hedwig free of her traces. As she soars into the sky, Harry and Lupin watch from the lake's edge.

dialogues.speaker: HARRY
dialogues.text: Why do they affect me so, Professor? I mean, more than everyone else...

dialogues.speaker: PROFESSOR LUPIN
dialogues.text: Dementors are among the foulest creatures that walk this earth. They feed on every good feeling, every happy memory, until a person is left with nothing but his worst experiences. You're not weak, Harry. The Dementors affect you most, because there are true horrors in your past. Horrors your classmates can scarcely imagine. You have nothing to be ashamed of.

dialogues.speaker: HARRY
dialogues.text: I'm scared, Professor.

dialogues.speaker: PROFESSOR LUPIN
dialogues.text: I'd consider you a fool if you weren't. (CONTINUED )

dialogues.speaker: HARRY
dialogues.text: I need to learn how to fight them. You could teach me, Professor. You made that Dementor on the train go away...
