dialogues.speaker: PROFESSOR LUPIN
dialogues.text: There was only one that night...

dialogues.speaker: HARRY
dialogues.text: But you made it go away.

dialogues.speaker: PROFESSOR LUPIN
dialogues.text: (a beat) I don't pretend to be an expert, Harry. But yes, I can teach you. Perhaps after the holiday. For now, though, I need to rest. I'm feeling... tired. Harry turns, studies Lupin's haggard face. A weary smile appears as Hedwig's reflection glides over Lupin's irises.

dialogues.speaker: PROFESSOR LUPIN
dialogues.text: Beautiful... Harry looks up, watches Hedwig pinwheel through the blue, past the CLOCK TOWER and EXIT FRAME. CAMERA HOLDS, the skies PALES, and SNOW begins to fall. We TILT DOWN...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: ... to Hogwarts castle, weeks later, dusted in white.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Harry, framed in the window, stares out, looking forlorn. In REFLECTION, SNOW falls on the glass.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: A ragged line of students follows McGonagall toward the bridge. Harry's POV becomes OBJECTIVE and...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: -+. FOOTPRINTS appear in the snow, moving quickly to join the other students. (CONTINUED )

dialogues.speaker: CONTINUED
dialogues.text: Suddenly, Fred and George appear, heading the opposite way and... the FOOTPRINTS reverse themselves... as if Fred and George were escorting an invisible person.

dialogues.speaker: FRED
dialogues.text: Clever, Harry.

dialogues.speaker: GEORGE
dialogues.text: But not clever enough.

dialogues.speaker: FRED
dialogues.text: Besides, we've got a better way.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The great doors open and Fred and George enter. The INVISIBILITY CLOAK drops and Harry is revealed, looking cross. Instantly, Fred slaps a WORN ROLL OF PARCHMENT into his hand. Harry unfurls it. Frowns. It's blank.

dialogues.speaker: HARRY
dialogues.text: What's this rubbish?

dialogues.speaker: FRED
dialogues.text: Rubbish he says. That there's the secret to our success.

dialogues.speaker: GEORGE
dialogues.text: It's a wrench giving it to you, believe me.

dialogues.speaker: FRED
dialogues.text: But we've decided your need's greater than ours. George, if you will...

dialogues.speaker: GEORGE
dialogues.text: I solemnly swear that I am up to no good. George touches his wand to the parchment and INTRICATE INK LINES surface in the fiber of the paper, spread like veins. Harry reads the CURIOUS WORDS at the top:

dialogues.speaker: HARRY
dialogues.text: ‘Messrs Moony, Wormtail, Padfoot and Prongs are proud to present The Marauder's Map'...?

dialogues.speaker: GEORGE
dialogues.text: Ah... Moony, Wormtail, Padfoot and Prongs. We owe them so much. (CONTINUED )

dialogues.speaker: HARRY
dialogues.text: Hang on. This is Hogwarts! And that... No. Is that really... Harry points to a small MOVING DOT labeled "Dumbledore."

dialogues.speaker: FRED
dialogues.text: Dumbledore.

dialogues.speaker: GEORGE
dialogues.text: In his study.

dialogues.speaker: FRED
dialogues.text: Pacing.

dialogues.speaker: GEORGE
dialogues.text: Does that a lot.

dialogues.speaker: HARRY
dialogues.text: You mean, this map shows...

dialogues.speaker: FRED
dialogues.text: Everyone.

dialogues.speaker: HARRY
dialogues.text: Everyone?

dialogues.speaker: GEORGE
dialogues.text: Everyone.

dialogues.speaker: FRED
dialogues.text: Where they are.

dialogues.speaker: GEORGE
dialogues.text: What they're doing.

dialogues.speaker: FRED
dialogues.text: Every minute.

dialogues.speaker: GEORGE
dialogues.text: Of every day.

dialogues.speaker: HARRY
dialogues.text: Brilliant! Where'd you get it?

dialogues.speaker: FRED
dialogues.text: Nicked it from Filch's office, of course, first year. Now listen. There's seven secret passageways out of the castle. But we'd recommend... (CONTINUED )

dialogues.speaker: FRED/GEORGE
dialogues.text: This one.

dialogues.speaker: GEORGE
dialogues.text: The One-Eyed Witch on the third floor.

dialogues.speaker: HARRY
dialogues.text: The One-Eyed...

dialogues.speaker: FRED
dialogues.text: Witch, right. But you best hurry. Filch is heading this way. (as they go) Oh. And, Harry? When you're done, make sure to give it a tap and say, ‘Mischief managed.’ Otherwise, anyone can read it.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Harry approaches a STATUE of a hump-backed, ONE-EYED WITCH. INSERT MAP -- Harry traces his finger along the tattered surface to an INK FIGURE labeled "Harry Potter." A tiny SPEECH BUBBLE appears: "Dissendium."

dialogues.speaker: HARRY
dialogues.text: Dissendium? CLICK! The witch's EYE OPENS and the statue pivots, revealing a DARK OPENING in the floor. As Harry crouches, squinting, a cool DRAFT OF AIR ruffles his hair and the CAMERA DRIFTS INTO the DARKNESS...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: A tiny LIGHT bobs in the distance, fracturing the darkness, then Harry appears, the tip of his wand GLOWING, map in hand. INSERT MAP: “Harry Potter" glides across the parchment.

dialogues.speaker: DAY, (LATER)
dialogues.text: Harry stops, cranes his neck. STONE STEPS. Taps the map.

dialogues.speaker: HARRY
dialogues.text: Mischief managed.  76 77 78 79 61.

dialogues.speaker: CRATES. HUGE ROLLING BINS. A WOOD STAIRCASE. A
dialogues.text: trapdoor lifts. Harry's eyes appear. As he pulls himself up, a DOOR BANGS OPEN. Dense CHATTER ROARS from above. Quickly, Harry hides, watches a MAN'S BOOTS descend the stairs. Then...

dialogues.speaker: WOMAN, (0.S.)
dialogues.text: A box of Jelly Slugs as well, Horace. We're nearly cleared out. HORACE grunts, begins moving boxes. Harry looks up to the cellar door, takes out the invisibility cloak...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The CELLAR DOOR EASES open -- but no one appears. We TRACK THROUGH a sweet tooth's dream, SWARMING with customers. Up ahead, Neville prepares to lick the LOLLIPOP in his hand, when it simply floats from his fingers and out the door...

dialogues.speaker: ACTION
dialogues.text: ... into the MISTY, FOG-SHROUDED chaos of Main Street. As the lollipop drifts on, FOOTPRINTS appear in the snow below...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: At this elevation, the MIST hangs in thick, undulating veils, the Shrieking Shack an eerie silhouette in the gloom. Ron and Hermione stand stiffly, attempting, as best they can, to conceal the fact that, basically, they're scared stiff.

dialogues.speaker: HERMIONE
dialogues.text: It's meant to be the most haunted building in Britain. Did I mention that?

dialogues.speaker: RON
dialogues.text: Twice.

dialogues.speaker: HERMIONE
dialogues.text: Should we move a bit closer?

dialogues.speaker: RON
dialogues.text: Huh? Oh... All right... (CONTINUED )

dialogues.speaker: CONTINUED
dialogues.text: They take a step. One step. Stop dead.

dialogues.speaker: RON
dialogues.text: Actually, it's fine from here.

dialogues.speaker: HERMIONE
dialogues.text: Perfect. Just then, VOICES ECHO and THREE FIGURES appear over the rise, phantoms in the mist. Malfoy. Crabbe. Goyle. Pike.

dialogues.speaker: DRACO
dialogues.text: Well, well. Look who's here. You two shopping for your dream home? Seems a bit grand for you, Weasel- Bee. Don't your family all sleep in one room?

dialogues.speaker: RON
dialogues.text: Shut your mouth, Malfoy.

dialogues.speaker: DRACO
dialogues.text: (clucking his tongue) Now that's not very friendly. Boys, I think we're going to have to teach Weasel-Bee to respect his superiors.

dialogues.speaker: HERMIONE
dialogues.text: (a harsh chuckle) Hope you don't mean yourself. Malfoy's eyes shift, regard Hermione with disgust.

dialogues.speaker: DRACO
dialogues.text: How dare you speak to me, you filthy, little mud -- SPLAT! Malfoy takes a SNOWBALL to the grill. Splutters:

dialogues.speaker: DRACO
dialogues.text: Who did that! Malfoy glances about in confusion, when -- SPLAT! SPLAT! -- he takes two more. Hermione and Ron glance about uneasily.

dialogues.speaker: DRACO
dialogues.text: Well, don't just stand there! (CONTINUED )

dialogues.speaker: CONTINUED
dialogues.text: Crabbe and Goyle start for Ron and Hermione, when -- FLUMPH! -- their knees go out and they fall headfirst into the snow. Draco begins to back away fearfully, eying the mist...

dialogues.speaker: DRACO
dialogues.text: Wait a minute, there's something out here -- Aaaaaaahhhh!!! Malfoy's SKI MASK is pulled over his eyes, he's spun about, given a ROUGH KICK to the ass and sent stumbling over the rise and out of sight. Instantly, Crabbe and Goyle join him. Ron and Hermione stand frozen, exchange a nervous glance, and... DASH OFF... when -- FLUMPH! -- they both go flying, land on their pants in the snow. As they sit up, they hear... LAUGHTER. Hermione's eyes narrow in suspicion.

dialogues.speaker: HERMIONE
dialogues.text: Harry...? Harry? The Invisibility Cloak drops. Sure enough. Harry. Grinning.

dialogues.speaker: RON
dialogues.text: Bloody hell, Harry! That was not funny! But he's smiling. They all are. As he and Hermione pelt Harry with SNOWBALLS, we -- cut TO:

dialogues.speaker: LATER
dialogues.text: The trio trudge through the SWIRLING SNOW. Harry's donned Hermione's scarf and Ron's hat to disguise himself.

dialogues.speaker: RON
dialogues.text: Those weasels! Never told me about any Marauder's Map!

dialogues.speaker: HERMIONE
dialogues.text: But Harry isn't going to keep it. He's going to turn it over to Professor McGonagall, aren't you? (CONTINUED )

dialogues.speaker: RON
dialogues.text: Oh sure. Along with his invisibility cloak, his pack of exploding snap cards, his --

dialogues.speaker: HERMIONE
dialogues.text: Oh, shut up.

dialogues.speaker: CORNELIUS FUDGE, (0.S.)
dialogues.text: Rosmerta, m'dear! Up ahead Cornelius Fudge emerges from a MINISTRY SLEIGH as Hagrid swings the door clear and -- with unfortunate ease -- rips it clean off the fittings. Fudge joins McGonagall and a CURVY BARMAID (ROSMERTA) outside the THREE BROOMSTICKS PUB.

dialogues.speaker: HERMIONE
dialogues.text: That's Madam Rosmerta. Ron fancies her.

dialogues.speaker: RON
dialogues.text: It's not true!

dialogues.speaker: HARRY
dialogues.text: Shhh.

dialogues.speaker: CORNELIUS FUDGE
dialogues.text: I trust business is good?

dialogues.speaker: MADAM ROSMERTA
dialogues.text: It'd be a right sight better if the Ministry wasn't sending Dementors into my pub every other night.

dialogues.speaker: CORNELIUS FUDGE
dialogues.text: We have a killer on the loose.

dialogues.speaker: MADAM ROSMERTA
dialogues.text: Sirius Black? In Hogsmeade! And what would bring him here?

dialogues.speaker: CORNELIUS FUDGE
dialogues.text: Harry Potter.

dialogues.speaker: MADAM ROSMERTA
dialogues.text: Harry Potter! (CONTINUED )

dialogues.speaker: CONTINUED
dialogues.text: Fudge looks around nervously, then jerks his head toward the pub. As he leads Rosmerta and McGonagall inside, we --

dialogues.speaker: RON
dialogues.text: Harry? He's gone. FOOTPRINTS track through the snow, into the pu

dialogues.speaker: INVISIBILITY CLOAK
dialogues.text: .».. as he THREADS THROUGH the teeming pub, PAST a SIGN ("No Underage Wizards") and nearly collides with some very STRANGE-LOOKING PATRONS. Ron and Hermione ripple briefly past a frosted window, then... THREE SHRUNKEN HEADS swing INTO VIEW.

dialogues.speaker: SHRUNKEN HEAD
dialogues.text: So I says to him, ‘Careful, Ned. Don't want to go losing your head!' As the three heads CACKLE HYSTERICALLY, bobbing up and down on their strings, Harry turns... just as an UNSHAVEN WIZARD'S arm whips down and a DART goes WHISTLING right toward Harry's eyes. Harry DUCKS, pivots, and -- THWOCK! -- sees the dart pierce the cork of the disfigured DARTBOARD behind him. Harry hurries on, trailing Fudge and McGonagall up a DARK STAIRWELL as Rosmerta leads them into a small BACK ROOM. As the door starts to close, Harry rushes forward: SLAM! Too late. CAMERA TILTS. The KNOB turns, the door opens...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: --. and SNOW flutters off the sill of a HALF-OPEN WINDOW. McGonagall turns, frowning, and re-closes the door, harder this time, then joins Fudge and Rosmerta. HARRY'S POV SHIFTS FROM one TO the other as they speak.

dialogues.speaker: MADAM ROSMERTA
dialogues.text: Come on then. Let's hear it. (CONTINUED )
82 PROFESSOR McGONAGALL Years ago, when Harry Potter's parents were marked for death, they went into hiding. Few knew where they were. One who did was black. And he told...

dialogues.speaker: MADAM ROSMERTA
dialogues.text: You-Know-Who. I've heard this rot. It was all over The Daily Prophet back in the day. And I'll say now what I said then: Of all the boys I ran out of here, Black's the last who would've gone over to the dark side. Hearsay. That's all the Ministry had. Hearsay.

dialogues.speaker: CORNELIUS FUDGE
dialogues.text: Ha! Tell that to Peter Pettigrew!

dialogues.speaker: MADAM ROSMERTA
dialogues.text: Peter Pettigrew? PROFESSOR McGONAGALL Little lump of a boy? Always tagging after Black and...

dialogues.speaker: MADAM ROSMERTA
dialogues.text: I remember him. What's he got to do with it? PROFESSOR McGONAGALL After the Potters were killed, Pettigrew went looking for Black. And, unfortunately... found him.

dialogues.speaker: CORNELIUS FUDGE
dialogues.text: Black was vicious. He didn't kill Pettigrew. He destroyed him. A finger. That's all that was left. A finger -- there's your hearsay. Rosmerta looks to McGonagall. She nods grimly. PROFESSOR McGONAGALL Sirius Black may not have put his hands to the Potters, but he's the reason they're dead. And now he wants to finish what he started.

dialogues.speaker: MADAM ROSMERTA
dialogues.text: Harry. (CONTINUED )

dialogues.speaker: CONTINUED
dialogues.text: McGonagall nods, then looks pained.

dialogues.speaker: CORNELIUS FUDGE
dialogues.text: But that's not the worst of it.

dialogues.speaker: MADAM ROSMERTA
dialogues.text: What could be worse? PROFESSOR McGONAGALL This: Sirius Black was and remains today... Harry Potter's godfather. BLAM! The pub doors fly open, REVEAL Main Street, where Ron and Hermione wait, rubbing their hands against the chill. As they look down, CAMERA TILTS...

dialogues.speaker: DAY
dialogues.text: --. and FOOTPRINTS appear in the snow. HARRY'S POV ENDS. CAMERA TILTS UP, FOLLOWS Hermione and Ron until they LEAVE FRAME, then HOLDS ON a POSTER of BLACK, fluttering against a lamppost: "Have you seen this wizard?"

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: At the end of a ROCKY OUTCROP, the FOOTPRINTS end and SOBS are heard. Ron takes Hermione's arm, discouraging her from going further, but she does, filling the footprints with her own, then kneeling and -- very gently -- drawing the cloak from Harry. He stares into the mist, eyes stinging with tears.

dialogues.speaker: HARRY
dialogues.text: He was their friend. And he betrayed them. He was their friend. (eyes hardening) I hope he finds me. But when he does, I'm going to be ready. When he does, I'm going to kill him.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Butterflies flutter over the great green lawn. The GIANT SQUID breaks through the last GLAZE of ICE on the Black Lake. The Whomping Willow shakes the water from its branches...  86 68.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The DYING SUN streams through high windows, painting Harry's face a fierce AMBER-RED as he stands opposite Lupin. ANCIENT CHARTS drape the walls while gleaming SPHERES OF SPUN GLASS ORBIT one another silently. Lupin paces before a LARGE TRUNK.

dialogues.speaker: PROFESSOR LUPIN
dialogues.text: You're sure about this, Harry? This is very advanced magic. Well beyond Ordinary Wizarding Level.

dialogues.speaker: HARRY
dialogues.text: If Black can fight the Dementors, I need to know how too. Lupin studies Harry -- as if conflicted -- then decides.

dialogues.speaker: PROFESSOR LUPIN
dialogues.text: Very well. The spell I'm going to teach you is called the Patronus Charm. Ever hear of it? Harry shakes his head.

dialogues.speaker: PROFESSOR LUPIN
dialogues.text: A Patronus is a kind of positive force. For the wizard who can conjure one, the Patronus works something like a shield. The Dementor feeds on it instead of him. Just then, the trunk RATTLES VIOLENTLY. As Harry's eyes wander, Lupin SNAPS his fingers, brings his attention back.

dialogues.speaker: PROFESSOR LUPIN
dialogues.text: But in order for it to work, you must think of a memory. And not just any. This memory needs to be a very happy one. And powerful. Harry thinks a bit. Then... nods.

dialogues.speaker: PROFESSOR LUPIN
dialogues.text: Got something? Good. Let it fill you up. Lose yourself in it. Then speak the incantation: Expecto Patronum. Without your wand...

dialogues.speaker: HARRY
dialogues.text: Expecto Patronum... (CONTINUED )

dialogues.speaker: PROFESSOR LUPIN
dialogues.text: Right then. Shall we? Harry nods, raises his wand. Lupin, watching closely, reaches over, grips the lid of the TRUNK...

dialogues.speaker: PROFESSOR LUPIN
dialogues.text: Concentrate, Harry. Concentrate... As Lupin FLINGS open the case, Harry OPENS HIS EYES. In the sun's BLOOD-LIGHT, the Dementor looks particularly horrific.

dialogues.speaker: HARRY
dialogues.text: Expecto... Patronum... The torches on the wall FLICKER as a CHILL BREEZE fills the chamber. A SCREAM ECHOES distantly. Harry's hand trembles. His eyes begin to roll up...

dialogues.speaker: HARRY
dialogues.text: Expecto... Expecto...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Here! CRACK! -- the Dementor mutates into a SILVERY WHITE ORB.

dialogues.speaker: PROFESSOR LUPIN
dialogues.text: Riddikulus! Lupin flicks his wand, sends the orb back into the packing case. Harry stands blinking. Dazed. Lupin fishes a CHOCOLATE FROG from his pocket. Presses it into Harry's trembling hand.

dialogues.speaker: PROFESSOR LUPIN
dialogues.text: Quickly. Harry studies the frog. Takes a bite. Begins to recover.

dialogues.speaker: HARRY
dialogues.text: That's one nasty Dementor.

dialogues.speaker: PROFESSOR LUPIN
dialogues.text: Boggart, Harry. The real thing would be much, much worse. Just out of interest, what were you thinking of? What memory did you choose? (CONTINUED )

dialogues.speaker: HARRY
dialogues.text: The first time I rode a broom.

dialogues.speaker: PROFESSOR LUPIN
dialogues.text: That's not good enough, Harry. Not nearly. Harry glances toward the window, at the bloody sun.

dialogues.speaker: HARRY
dialogues.text: There's another. It's not happy exactly. I mean, it is. It's the happiest I've ever felt. But it's... complicated.

dialogues.speaker: PROFESSOR LUPIN
dialogues.text: Is it strong? Harry looks up into Lupin's eyes. Emotional. Nods.

dialogues.speaker: PROFESSOR LUPIN
dialogues.text: Then let's try it. Harry takes a breath. Tosses the frog aside. Poises himself.

dialogues.speaker: PROFESSOR LUPIN
dialogues.text: Think, Harry, think --

dialogues.speaker: HARRY
dialogues.text: Just do it! Lupin blinks at Harry's quiet fierceness. Opens the packing case. Instantly, the Dementor appears again. A chill fills the air. The hair skates off Harry's scar. He sets his jaw...

dialogues.speaker: HARRY
dialogues.text: Expecto Patronum! Harry's hand TREMBLES. His whole BODY TREMBLES. But he holds his ground, when -- WHOOSH! -- a huge SILVER SHADOW BURSTS from the end of his wand, hovering between him and the Dementor. The Dementor falters... Harry's legs like water...

dialogues.speaker: PROFESSOR LUPIN
dialogues.text: Riddikulus! CRACK! The Dementor vanishes. Harry's arm drops. Slack. Lupin eyes Harry with a kind of awe. His voice barely a WHISPER. (CONTINUED )

dialogues.speaker: PROFESSOR LUPIN
dialogues.text: Well done.

dialogues.speaker: HARRY
dialogues.text: I think I've had enough. For today. Lupin nods. Watches Harry move to the door.

dialogues.speaker: PROFESSOR LUPIN
dialogues.text: So you know, Harry: You'd have given your father a run for his money. And, believe me, that's saying something. Harry ponders this. Then speaks, deep inside himself.

dialogues.speaker: HARRY
dialogues.text: I was thinking of him. And Mum. Seeing their faces. They're just talking to me. Just... talking. That was the memory I chose. I don't even know if it's real... Harry grips the door, pushes past.

dialogues.speaker: HARRY
dialogues.text: But it's the best I have.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: All the boys asleep. All except Harry, who lies in bed, studying the photo of his parents, barely visible in the fluttering light of a guttering candle. As the FLAME DIES with a soft HISS, all goes BLACK and we --

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: A hulking, haunted goliath against the sky.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: A cautious breeze rises. Leaves scud across the gravel.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: A church. Empty. Silent.  91 92 92a

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: A WINDOWPANE RATTLES, up high, the corridor thatched in shadow. Slowly... CAMERA BEGINS TO MOVE. CREEPING FORWARD. A SHADOW ENGULFS Sir Cadogan, dozing against his tree...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: A WHISTLE SHRIEKS. The Sneakoscope, whirling madly, skitters across the bedside cabinet and -- CLICK! CLICK! CLICK! -- taps against a WATER GLASS, sending shafts of RED LIGHT pinwheeling over the photo of Harry's parents...

dialogues.speaker: RON
dialogues.text: Aaaahhhh! Harry BOLTS UP, sees a SILHOUETTE etched on the window -- a MAN CLUTCHING A KNIFE. All the boys are up now. Screaming. Amid the chaos, Harry grabs his wand.

dialogues.speaker: HARRY
dialogues.text: Everybody out! The others flee. Harry faces the HULKING SHADOW, wand poised.

dialogues.speaker: HARRY
dialogues.text: Show yourself. Crash! The water GLASS SHATTERS on the floor and Scabbers darts past Harry's bare feet, chased by Crookshanks. Seizing the moment, the SILHOUETTE grasps the curtains and swings through the open window, plunging into the night. Harry rushes to the window, looks down.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The SILHOUETTE leaps from ledge to ledge with an animal's grace, then... vanishes.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Harry sweeps Ron's curtains aside. His bed is... empty.

dialogues.speaker: HARRY
dialogues.text: Ron! Ron! Harry's eyes flash toward the window, when... Ron pokes his head out from under the bed.

dialogues.speaker: RON
dialogues.text: Is he gone?  93 73.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The entire Gryffindor House, in pajamas, stand before McGonagall, who wears a TARTAN ROBE and an expression of singular irritation. PROFESSOR McGONAGALL That's preposterous, Weasley. How could Sirius Black possibly have got through the portrait hole?

dialogues.speaker: RON
dialogues.text: I don't know how he got in! I was a bit busy dodging his knife! Just then, a curiously content Crookshanks wends his way through Ron's legs.

dialogues.speaker: RON
dialogues.text: And this bloody cat ate my rat!

dialogues.speaker: HERMIONE
dialogues.text: That's a lie!

dialogues.speaker: RON
dialogues.text: It is not and you bloody well know it! PROFESSOR McGONAGALL Silence! McGonagall turns then and everyone follows her eye to Sir Cadogan who, sensing the attention, perks up instantly. Every eye

dialogues.speaker: DUMBLEDORE
dialogues.text: Sir Cadogan. Is it possible that you let a mysterious man enter Gryffindor Tower tonight?

dialogues.speaker: SIR CADOGAN
dialogues.text: Certainly, good lady! He had the password. Had the whole week's, in fact. On a little piece of paper. PROFESSOR McGONAGALL Which abysmally foolish person wrote down the passwords and then proceeded to lose them! shifts once more: Neville. McGonagall sighs. PROFESSOR McGONAGALL Is it always going to be you, Longbottom? (CONTINUED )

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: 93 94 thru

dialogues.speaker: NEVILLE
dialogues.text: I'm afraid so, ma'am. PROFESSOR McGONAGALL (to the group at large) While we know Sirius Black is gone tonight, I think you can safely assume he will, at some future time, attempt to return. Let me be clear. You are not to move about the castle alone. And you are not to write down the password! Understood! A collective nod of the head. McGonagall gives the ties of her robe a sharp tug, collects herself, and exits. PROFESSOR McGONAGALL Very well then. Go to bed. As the students drift off, Ron casts a last angry glance toward Hermione, who now holds Crookshanks in her arms.

dialogues.speaker: HARRY
dialogues.text: I could've killed him. Hermione turns, sees Harry staring out the window.

dialogues.speaker: HARRY
dialogues.text: He was right there. Close enough to touch. I could've killed him.

dialogues.speaker: OMITTED 94
dialogues.text: thru 96

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The trio make their way down the slope.

dialogues.speaker: RON
dialogues.text: I find it astonishing that someone who prides herself on being so logical can be in such denial.

dialogues.speaker: HERMIONE
dialogues.text: Harry. Will you explain to your friend Ronald that he has absolutely no proof whatsoever that my sweet, unassuming cat ate his shabby, decidedly decrepit rat. (CONTINUED)

dialogues.speaker: RON
dialogues.text: Harry was there! He'll tell you how it was. Go on, Harry, tell her.

dialogues.speaker: HARRY
dialogues.text: No, I won't. Know why? Because I don't care about your stupid rat! I don't care about your stupid cat! I've got few other things on my mind right now!

dialogues.speaker: RON
dialogues.text: Really? Wasn't you had to roll under the bed last night to avoid getting cut to ribbons! A person could die being your friend, Harry! Ron stops, wishes he could take it back. They all wish he could. Avoiding each other's eyes, they turn, continue on.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Hagrid, wearing a GIGANTIC, HAIRY BROWN SUIT and perhaps the world's ugliest YELLOW AND ORANGE TIE, stands knee- deep in the shallows of the Black Lake, skimming rocks as big as flagstones across the water's shiny gloss. As he turns, the trio catches a brief sight of his eyes, red with tears, then he looks away.

dialogues.speaker: HERMIONE
dialogues.text: How'd it go, Hagrid?

dialogues.speaker: HAGRID
dialogues.text: Buckbeak liked London.

dialogues.speaker: HERMIONE
dialogues.text: I meant the hearing.

dialogues.speaker: HAGRID
dialogues.text: Oh. That. Well, I got up an' said my bit -- You know, how Buckbeak was a good Hippogriff an' as long as yeh treated ‘im with respect, he'd treat you the same. Then Lucius Malfoy got up an' said his bit -- you know, how Buckbeak was a deadly dangerous beast that no teacher in their righ' mind would expose their students to... (CONTINUED )

dialogues.speaker: HERMIONE
dialogues.text: (dreading it) And...? Hagrid slings another rock into water.

dialogues.speaker: HERMIONE
dialogues.text: You mustn't blame yourself, Hagrid.

dialogues.speaker: RON
dialogues.text: Draco. It's him the Committee should punish. It's him they should send off to the forest, not Buckbeak.

dialogues.speaker: HAGRID
dialogues.text: Buckbeak's not going back to the forest...

dialogues.speaker: HERMIONE
dialogues.text: (dreading the answer) Where's he going, Hagrid?

dialogues.speaker: HAGRID
dialogues.text: He asked fer the worse, yeh see, Lucius Malfoy did. An' the Committee granted it. Buckbeak's bin sentenced ter death.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Dark. Ominous. Dementors drift in the distance. Restless...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Silent. A room of shadows. While those around him slumber, Harry lies awake, unable to sleep. Finally, he turns to his cupboard, takes the Marauder's Map.

dialogues.speaker: HARRY
dialogues.text: I solemnly swear that I am up to no good. The crooked corridors and serpentine passageways of Hogwarts radiate across the parchment, then... a TINY DOT catches Harry's eye. He frowns. It reads: “Peter Pettigrew."  100 77.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Harry moves down a DARK corridor, map in hand, WAND AGLOW. In the PAINTINGS he passes, the subjects SNORE SOFTLY.

dialogues.speaker: MARAUDER'S MAP
dialogues.text: "Harry Potter" and "Peter Pettigrew" draw closer and closer.

dialogues.speaker: BACK TO SCENE
dialogues.text: Harry squints toward the end of the corridor. Down at the map. Pettigrew moves quickly down the adjoining corridor. Twenty yards away. Ten. Only seconds away... Wand trembling in his hand, Harry glances from the map to the dark corridor ahead, again and again. Then... as the two DOTS are about to collide... he looks slowly up... turns the corner... heart in his chest... and meets...

dialogues.speaker: HIMSELF
dialogues.text: ... reflected in a MIRROR. He BLINKS, startled, then glances back down at the map. Pettigrew has moved past him. Confused, Harry wheels, casts his wand along the walls.

dialogues.speaker: VOICE, (0.S.)
dialogues.text: Watch it there, boy! Harry JUMPS. But it's only an OLD MAN in a PAINTING, scowling in the glare of Harry's wand light. On the map, "Pettigrew" continues to move away. Harry makes to follow, then stops. HEARS FOOTSTEPS. The WAND'S SPOT dances across the parchment, finds another DOT. Approaching FAST: “Severus Snape."

dialogues.speaker: HARRY
dialogues.text: Mischief managed! Harry stashes the map, extinguishes his wand, and turns... into the harsh glare of Snape's wand.

dialogues.speaker: SNAPE
dialogues.text: Potter. What're you doing wandering the corridors at night?

dialogues.speaker: HARRY
dialogues.text: I was... I was... sleepwalking... A sneer curdles the corners of Snape's lips. (CONTINUED )

dialogues.speaker: SNAPE
dialogues.text: How extraordinarily like your father you are, Potter. He, too, was exceedingly arrogant. Strutting about the castle --

dialogues.speaker: HARRY
dialogues.text: My dad didn’t strut. Nor do I. Now, if you don't mind, I'd appreciate you lowering your wand. Snape eyes Harry coldly. Containing himself. Lowers his wand.

dialogues.speaker: SNAPE
dialogues.text: Turn out your pockets. Harry doesn't move, eyes still boring into Snape.

dialogues.speaker: SNAPE
dialogues.text: Turn out your pockets! Finally, Harry obliges. Seeing the map, Snape's eyes glitter.

dialogues.speaker: SNAPE
dialogues.text: And this. What might it be?

dialogues.speaker: HARRY
dialogues.text: Spare bit of parchment...

dialogues.speaker: SNAPE
dialogues.text: Really... (poising his wand) Reveal your secret! To Harry's horror, words begin to appear. Snape studies him, a sadistic half-smile on his lips. Turns the map his way.

dialogues.speaker: SNAPE
dialogues.text: Read it.

dialogues.speaker: HARRY
dialogues.text: ‘Messrs. Moony, Wormtail, Padfoot and Prongs offer their compliments to Professor Snape and...'

dialogues.speaker: SNAPE
dialogues.text: Go on. (CONTINUED )

dialogues.speaker: HARRY
dialogues.text: ... and request that he keep his abnormally large nose out of other people's business.'

dialogues.speaker: SNAPE
dialogues.text: (smile drooping) Why you insolent little --

dialogues.speaker: PROFESSOR LUPIN
dialogues.text: Professor...? Snape turns. Sees Lupin standing in the shadows.

dialogues.speaker: SNAPE
dialogues.text: Well, well. Lupin. Out for a little walk in the moonlight, are we?

dialogues.speaker: PROFESSOR LUPIN
dialogues.text: Harry? You all right?

dialogues.speaker: SNAPE
dialogues.text: That remains to be seen. I've just now confiscated a rather curious artifact from Mr. Potter. Take a look, Lupin. This is supposed to be your area of expertise. Lupin takes the parchment, which now displays a rather unflattering caricature of Snape and a pair of potions.

dialogues.speaker: SNAPE
dialogues.text: Clearly, it's full of Dark Magic.

dialogues.speaker: PROFESSOR LUPIN
dialogues.text: I seriously doubt that, Severus. It looks to me as if it merely insults anyone who tries to read it. I suspect it's a Zonko product. Nevertheless, I shall pursue any hidden qualities it may possess. As you say, it's my area of expertise. Come, Harry.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Harry walks aside a fuming Lupin, who grips the map fiercely. (CONTINUED )

dialogues.speaker: PROFESSOR LUPIN
dialogues.text: I don't know how this map came to be in your possession, Harry, but I'm astounded that you didn't turn it in. Did you ever stop to think that this -- in the hands of Sirius Black -- is a map to you? Harry walks silently. Lupin can barely contain his anger.

dialogues.speaker: PROFESSOR LUPIN
dialogues.text: Your father didn't set much store by rules either. But he and your mother did give their lives to save yours. Gambling their sacrifice by walking about the castle unprotected, with a killer on the loose, strikes me as a poor way to repay them. I won't cover up for you again, Harry. Lupin enters his office, tosses the map on his desk, and begins to sort through some papers. Harry lingers briefly in the doorway, absently eyes the WAXING MOON that glimmers beyond the window, then starts to turn away. Stops.

dialogues.speaker: HARRY
dialogues.text: Professor. Just so you know, I don't think the map always works. Earlier, it showed someone in the castle. Someone I know to be dead.

dialogues.speaker: PROFESSOR LUPIN
dialogues.text: (only half-listening) And who was that, Harry?

dialogues.speaker: HARRY
dialogues.text: Peter Pettigrew. Lupin hesitates ever-so-slightly, then returns to his papers.

dialogues.speaker: PROFESSOR LUPIN
dialogues.text: Very well. I'd like you to return to your dormitory now. Oh, and Harry? Don't take any detours. As Harry looks back, Lupin taps the map.

dialogues.speaker: PROFESSOR LUPIN
dialogues.text: If you do. I'11 know. cut TO: (CONTINUED )

dialogues.speaker: CRYSTAL BALL
dialogues.text: murky with smoke.

dialogues.speaker: PROFESSOR TRELAWNEY, (V.O.)
dialogues.text: Relax... Let your mind... go...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The students gaze into CRYSTAL BALLS, faces reflecting the mist within, so that their very skin seems to be made of smoke. Conspicuously, Harry, Ron and Hermione sit apart.

dialogues.speaker: PROFESSOR TRELAWNEY
dialogues.text: Crystal-gazing requires that you clear the Inner Eye. Only then, will you... See. Oh my, what do we have here...? As Trelawney eyes Harry's crystal, Hermione rolls her eyes.

dialogues.speaker: HERMIONE
dialogues.text: Here we go again. It's the Grim! It's the Grim!

dialogues.speaker: PROFESSOR TRELAWNEY
dialogues.text: (eyes narrowing) My dear, from the moment you first arrived in my class, I sensed that you did not possess the proper spirit for the noble art of Divination. You may be young in years, but the heart that beats beneath your bosom is as shriveled as an old maid's, your soul as dry as the pages of the books to which you so desperately cleave. Stung, Hermione starts to reply, but -- remarkably -- seems incapable of a single word. Rising gracelessly, she exits, knocking her crystal ball to the floor. Harry watches curiously as the ball rolls slowly OUT the doorway...

dialogues.speaker: LAVENDER
dialogues.text: 'In late spring, one of our number will leave us forever!' You knew, Professor! You saw.

dialogues.speaker: PROFESSOR TRELAWNEY
dialogues.text: On these occasions, I take no joy in my gift, Miss Brown.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: As the students exit, Ron, walking separately from Harry, turns to Neville.

dialogues.speaker: RON
dialogues.text: She's gone mental, Hermione has. I mean, not that she wasn't always mental, but now it's out in the open for everyone to see... Ron stops, glances at Harry, then moves off. Harry watches him go, along with the others, then spies Hermione's crystal ball lying on the landing.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Harry sets Hermione's crystal back on its stand, starts to go, when... the SMOKE within the crystal suddenly DARKENS. Leaning close, Harry watches the shape that appears. It is unmistakable: Sirius Black. Just then, a SHADOW crawls the glossy surface of the crystal and... ++. a HAND SNATCHES Harry's shoulder. He wheels, finds...

dialogues.speaker: HARRY
dialogues.text: Professor Trelawney --

dialogues.speaker: PROFESSOR TRELAWNEY
dialogues.text: He will return tonight.... Harry stiffens. Trelawney's voice is eerily HOLLOW.

dialogues.speaker: HARRY
dialogues.text: S-sorry?

dialogues.speaker: PROFESSOR TRELAWNEY
dialogues.text: Tonight, when the clock strikes twelve, the servant shall break free. He and his Master shall be reunited. It cannot be prevented. Trelawney smiles savagely... then her head falls forward. When it rises, she blinks, eyes the hand that lies upon Harry's shoulder. Her hand.

dialogues.speaker: PROFESSOR TRELAWNEY
dialogues.text: So sorry, dear boy. Did you say something? Her voice is normal once more. Harry shakes his head.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Harry -- clearly unsettled by his encounter with Trelawney -- hastens down the stairs, and we... FADE OUT.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: SWOOK! SWOOK! We FADE UP ON a MOVING POV OF a CROW as it glides to the flock circling the feet of a POT-BELLIED MAN (THE EXECUTIONER) sitting in the courtyard. As he sharpens his AXE -- SWOOK! SWOOK! -- we -- cut TO:

dialogues.speaker: HARRY, RON AND HERMIONE
dialogues.text: hurrying past. The Executioner looks up and we -- cut TO:

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: ... Harry, leading Ron and Hermione toward Hagrid's hut.

dialogues.speaker: HERMIONE
dialogues.text: I can't believe they're going to kill Buckbeak! It's too horrible.

dialogues.speaker: HARRY
dialogues.text: It just got worse. She and Ron look and SEE:

dialogues.speaker: AFTERNOON
dialogues.text: Malfoy, along with Crabbe and Goyle, lurks within a grouping of monolithic menhirs, BINOCULARS in hand, spying on Hagrid, who stands in the pumpkin patch, tossing dead ferrets to Buckbeak. Hagrid wipes his eyes, lopes into the hut.

dialogues.speaker: DRACO
dialogues.text: Did you see the big, fat blubbering oaf?! Oh, this is going to be rich. Did I tell you, Father said I can keep the head -- (looking up) Ah. Come to see the show? (CONTINUED )

dialogues.speaker: HERMIONE
dialogues.text: You... foul... loathsome... evil... little cockroach... Malfoy stumbles back against a tree, cross-eyed with fear as Hermione jabs the tip of her wand under his nose, when...

dialogues.speaker: RON
dialogues.text: Hermione! No! She turns, surprised Ron's spoken to her. He looks away.

dialogues.speaker: RON
dialogues.text: He's not worth it. Hermione nods, then -- SMACK! -- quick as lightning, lands a looping right to Malfoy's jaw, putting him flat on his back. Stunned, he leaps to his feet and runs, Crabbe and Goyle huffing and puffing behind.

dialogues.speaker: HERMIONE
dialogues.text: That felt good.

dialogues.speaker: LATER
dialogues.text: The trio makes their way down the slope and past Buckbeak, chewing on a ferret with idle satisfaction.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Hagrid stands by the window watching Buckbeak. Harry and Ron sit. Hermione makes tea.

dialogues.speaker: HAGRID
dialogues.text: Look at ‘em. Loves the smell o' the trees when the wind blows...

dialogues.speaker: HARRY
dialogues.text: I say we set him free.

dialogues.speaker: HAGRID
dialogues.text: (shaking his head) They'd know I did it. And tha' would only get Dumbledore in trouble. Gonna come down, yeh know. Says he wants ter be with me when it... when it happens. Great man, Dumbledore. (CONTINUED )

dialogues.speaker: HERMIONE
dialogues.text: We'll stay with you too, Hagrid.

dialogues.speaker: HAGRID
dialogues.text: Yeh will not! Think I wan' yeh seein' a thing like this! No. Yeh'1ll drink yer tea an' be off. But before yeh do -- I wan' ter see you an' Ron shake hands, Harry. 85. 108 Ron and Harry exchange a glance, then look to Hagrid.

dialogues.speaker: HAGRID
dialogues.text: Thin' I haven' seen 'ow it's bin betw'n you two? Go on now... Reluctantly, Harry and Ron extend their hands. Shake.

dialogues.speaker: HAGRID
dialogues.text: Good. Now then. Ron, I wan' ter see you give Hermione a hug.

dialogues.speaker: HERMIONE/RON
dialogues.text: What!

dialogues.speaker: HAGRID
dialogues.text: Go on! You two've been at it all year. An' I'm sick o' it. Acutely uncomfortable, Hermione and Ron step forward and perform perhaps the most awkward hug Hogwarts has ever seen.

dialogues.speaker: HAGRID
dialogues.text: Crikey, tha's jus' abou' the most pathetic hug I e'er seen. But yeh did it, an' tha's wha' matters. There's jus' one other thing...

dialogues.speaker: RON
dialogues.text: I'm not kissing Fang if that's what you're thinking... Hearing his name, FANG -- Hagrid's giant boarhound -- THUMPS his tail happily on the floor. Hagrid turns, takes the lid from a FLOUR TIN, A TINY HEAD, ears flecked with powder, emerges.

dialogues.speaker: RON
dialogues.text: Scabbers! You're alive! (CONTINUED )

dialogues.speaker: HAGRID
dialogues.text: Yeh should keep a closer eye on yer pets, Ron.

dialogues.speaker: HERMIONE
dialogues.text: I think you owe someone an apology.

dialogues.speaker: RON
dialogues.text: Right. Next time I see Crookshanks, I'll let him know.

dialogues.speaker: HERMIONE
dialogues.text: I meant me.

dialogues.speaker: HAGRID
dialogues.text: Crikey. Here we go agin... SMASH! A GLASS JAR on the SHELF SHATTERS. As Hermione scoops up a JAGGED STAR-SHAPED STONE, a second STONE bounces off the back of Harry's head.

dialogues.speaker: HARRY
dialogues.text: Ow! Harry turns, looks out the window.

dialogues.speaker: HARRY
dialogues.text: Hagrid... Everyone turns. Looks. Dumbledore and Fudge approach. Behind them, in a fluttering shroud of CROWS, the Executioner follows, axe at his side. Hagrid begins to panic.

dialogues.speaker: HAGRID
dialogues.text: Yeh got to go! It's almost dark. Anyone sees yeh outside the castle it'll be trouble! Big trouble! ‘Specially you, Harry -- BANG! BANG! BANG! The door SHAKES. Hagrid stiffens in fear. Harry reaches up, puts his finger to Hagrid's trembling lips, speaks softly to the others.

dialogues.speaker: HARRY
dialogues.text: C'mon.

dialogues.speaker: DUSK 109
dialogues.text: (MOMENTS LATER)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: As the trio exit through the back door, Fudge, Dumbledore and the Executioner enter through the front. (CONTINUED )

dialogues.speaker: CONTINUED
dialogues.text: A veil of crows flutters onto the roof. More drop into the patch, begin to slowly circle Buckbeak. Harry and the others duck behind the pumpkins, watch Hagrid solemnly greet the others. Fudge appears at the window. Picks his nose. Just then, a Shhh! is heard. Hermione turns. The branches of the trees behind her are DANCING ODDLY.

dialogues.speaker: HARRY
dialogues.text: What?

dialogues.speaker: HERMIONE
dialogues.text: Nothing, I just thought I saw... Never mind.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The trio slip silently into a stand of trees. Beyond them, Hagrid's hut glimmers desolately in the dying sun. High in the CLOCK TOWER, a BELL begins to TOLL.

dialogues.speaker: DING
dialogues.text: The trio stops, fighting their tears. A QUARTET OF BLEAK SHADOWS files from the hut. One of the SHADOWS -- Dumbledore -- raises his hand and points, directing the attention of the others away from Buckbeak. Dumbledore speaks briefly -- unintelligible from this distance, then -- CAW! CAW! -- The crows SHRIEK excitedly and the Executioner separates from the others, disappears behind a LOW STAND OF TREES.

dialogues.speaker: DING
dialogues.text: All goes very still. The wind loses its voice...

dialogues.speaker: DING
dialogues.text: Sunlight kicks off the axe as it rises over the trees, INTO VIEW...

dialogues.speaker: DING
dialogues.text: The ax hangs seemingly forever, etched against the sky, then drops from sight. A SICKENING CHOP! fouls the breeze and Ron and Harry stare toward the trees in numb disbelief. Hermione, face turned away, trembles... (CONTINUED )

dialogues.speaker: DING
dialogues.text: The SUN sets, dropping behind the mountains in the distance. Hermione turns. Sees a frenzied spray of crows stain the bloody sky, their PRIMAL SHRIEKING rising like a curse. Slowly, Hermione's hand falls onto Ron's shoulder and CAMERA FALLS WITH her, CONTINUING DOWN the length of Ron's arm to his hand, where a DROP OF BLOOD hangs from his finger, drops like a tear...

dialogues.speaker: DING
dialogues.text: Ron stares at his hand. At the blood running down his finger.

dialogues.speaker: RON
dialogues.text: He bit me... His eyes shift. See Scabbers streaking away.

dialogues.speaker: HERMIONE
dialogues.text: Ron! No! As Ron pelts after Scabbers, Harry and Hermione give chase.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Ron reaches the summit, disappears over the top. Hermione and Harry follow.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Harry and Hermione reach the top of the ridge. Stop.

dialogues.speaker: HERMIONE
dialogues.text: Harry. You do realize what tree this is... Ron nabs Scabbers, cradles him in his bloody palm.

dialogues.speaker: RON
dialogues.text: Now behave yourself. CAMERA PULLS BACK: Ron is kneeling under the Whomping Willow. (CONTINUED )

dialogues.speaker: HARRY
dialogues.text: That's not good. (yelling) Ron! Run! Ron spins. Looks toward Harry.

dialogues.speaker: RON
dialogues.text: Harry! Run! Harry's eyes shift. Bounding toward him in the gathering gloom is an ENORMOUS, PALE-EYED, JET-BLACK... DOG. Harry shields himself when... the dog LEAPS CLEAR OVER HIM.

dialogues.speaker: RON
dialogues.text: Aaaahhh! The dog's TEETH flash and -- SNAP! -- close on Ron's foot, dragging him TOWARDS THE TRUNK like a rag doll. Instantly, Harry dashes forward, leaps out, and grabs Ron's hands... but he and Ron just keep skudding along the ground.

dialogues.speaker: HERMIONE
dialogues.text: I've got you -- Hermione pitches herself onto Harry's feet... and the three of them go scudding along.

dialogues.speaker: RON
dialogues.text: Harry! Harry raises his chin. The dog vanishes into the GAP at the base of the tree, begins to pull Ron through...

dialogues.speaker: HARRY
dialogues.text: Hold on, Ron! But it's no use. The dog is too powerful. Harry glances around desperately, then finds himself looking directly in Ron's eyes. He can read his mind.

dialogues.speaker: HARRY
dialogues.text: No, Ron... One by one, Ron releases his fingers from Harry's forearm. Sacrificing himself.

dialogues.speaker: HARRY
dialogues.text: Nooooo! !! But Ron closes his eyes, releases his hands fully, and... (CONTINUED )

dialogues.speaker: CONTINUED
dialogues.text: Disappears. As his VOICE ECHOES deep into the earth... Harry and Hermione rise, peer into the hole. WHOMP! The Whomping Willow sweeps first Hermione, then Harry, into the air and -- FLOOMPH -- drops them on their backsides.

dialogues.speaker: THE BRANCHES OVERHEAD
dialogues.text: Swaying beautifully against the dusky sky, swishing softly.

dialogues.speaker: BACK TO SCENE
dialogues.text: As one, they rise. Run back toward the gap in the tree. A branch swoops down. Hermione ducks. Harry doesn't. WHOOSH -- he is flung one way, his GLASSES the other. Hermione HOPS over another branch -- looks briefly pleased with herself -- only to find herself SWEPT HIGH IN THE AIR by a second branch. She looks down, sees Harry searching the ground for his glasses.

dialogues.speaker: HERMIONE
dialogues.text: Haaaaaaarrrrrrilllilii! Harry squints up, sees a PILE-DRIVING FIST of a branch screaming straight down for his head. He rolls away just as -- WHOMP! -- the branch PULVERIZES the ground. Hermione WHIPS THROUGH FRAME, still clinging on for dear life, and Harry rises. FLUMPH! -- he's promptly knocked to the ground again. Hermione goes CRASHING through the high branches, Harry spies his glasses and grabs them. Rising, he fits them to his face and... HIS BLURRY POV... ... turns CRYSTAL CLEAR just in time to see Hermione FLYING MADLY TOWARD HIM.

dialogues.speaker: HERMIONE
dialogues.text: Ahhhhhhhhhhhhhhhh!

dialogues.speaker: HARRY
dialogues.text: Ahhhhhhhhhhhhhhhh! Hermione reaches out, grabs Harry's shirt and -- riding the branch in tandem -- the two boomerang back, hurtling toward the trunk of the tree, through the gap, and into the darkness...  111

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: .».. below. OOMPH! Harry hits the ground hard. OOMPH! Hermione falls on top of him.

dialogues.speaker: HERMIONE
dialogues.text: Thanks.

dialogues.speaker: HARRY
dialogues.text: Don't mention it. Lumos. As the tip of Harry's WAND GLOWS, reveals a long, snaking tunnel.

dialogues.speaker: HERMIONE
dialogues.text: Where do you suppose this goes?

dialogues.speaker: HARRY
dialogues.text: I have a hunch. I just hope I'm wrong...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Harry and Hermione make their way through the primitive passageway, ducking the roots that dangle overhead. Then, abruptly, the tunnel... ends. Confused, Harry and Hermione glance about, then -- as one -- peer up. A small opening. Harry reaches up, hoists himself through.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Harry pulls Hermione up. Looks about. Paper peels from the walls. Stains -- suspiciously similar to dried blood -- blot the floorboards. Shattered furniture lies strewn everywhere.

dialogues.speaker: HERMIONE
dialogues.text: We're in the Shrieking Shack, aren't we? Harry doesn't answer, staring at the DOG PRINTS in the DU on the floor. The CEILING CREAKS. They dash to the stairs

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: They come out, look down. A wide, shiny stripe cuts through the DUST-LADEN floor -- as if something has been dragged -- to the end of the hallway, where a LIGHT seeps from a door.

dialogues.speaker: HARRY
dialogues.text: Nox. (CONTINUED )

dialogues.speaker: CONTINUED
dialogues.text: His wand-light dies. Slowly, they step to the door. Exchange a look. She nods, wand ready, and Harry KICKS the door aside.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Ron sits upon a sagging bed, clutching his bloody foot.

dialogues.speaker: HERMIONE
dialogues.text: Ron! You're okay --

dialogues.speaker: HARRY
dialogues.text: The dog -- where's the --

dialogues.speaker: RON
dialogues.text: It's a trap, Harry. He's the dog. He's an Animagus... Harry looks down, follows the PAW PRINTS on the floor to a pair of FILTHY HUMAN FEET. Harry looks up slowly at the MAN standing in the shadows. Filthy, matted hair hangs to his shoulders. His skin like a corpse. SIRIUS BLACK. He studies Harry's face keenly. Harry draws his wand.

dialogues.speaker: HERMIONE
dialogues.text: If you want to kill Harry, you'll -- you'll... have to kill us, too!

dialogues.speaker: SIRIUS BLACK
dialogues.text: No. Only one will die tonight.

dialogues.speaker: HARRY
dialogues.text: Then it'll be you!

dialogues.speaker: HERMIONE
dialogues.text: Harry! No! Just then, FOOTSTEPS sound. Black wheels toward the door, edgy. Harry eyes Black, wand hand shaking violently. As Black turns back, he stops, regards Harry cautiously.

dialogues.speaker: SIRIUS BLACK
dialogues.text: Going to kill me, Harry?

dialogues.speaker: HARRY
dialogues.text: Yes. (CONTINUED )

dialogues.speaker: CONTINUED
dialogues.text: Harry raises his wand. BLAM! -- the DOOR CRASHES OPEN: Lupin.

dialogues.speaker: HARRY /HERMIONE/RON
dialogues.text: Professor Lupin! Lupin ignores them, eying Black intensely.

dialogues.speaker: PROFESSOR LUPIN
dialogues.text: Looking a bit ragged, aren't we, Sirius? Finally the skin reflects the madness within.

dialogues.speaker: SIRIUS BLACK
dialogues.text: You'd know all about the madness within, wouldn't you, Remus? The two regard each other, the moment taut with tension, then Lupin steps forward and... EMBRACES Black like a brother.

dialogues.speaker: HERMIONE
dialogues.text: No! I trusted you! I covered up for you. And all this time you've been his friend! (pointing) He's a werewolf! That's why he's been missing classes! Harry and Ron stare, dumbfounded, at Lupin. Black HOWLS then, bitterly amused. Lupin eyes him, then turns back.

dialogues.speaker: PROFESSOR LUPIN
dialogues.text: How long have you known?

dialogues.speaker: HERMIONE
dialogues.text: Since Professor Snape set the essay.

dialogues.speaker: PROFESSOR LUPIN
dialogues.text: You're the brightest witch of your age I've ever met, Hermione.

dialogues.speaker: SIRIUS BLACK
dialogues.text: Yes, you glow like the sun. And you howl at the moon. Enough talk! He dies. Now. If you won't do it with me, Remus, I'1l1 do it alone.

dialogues.speaker: PROFESSOR LUPIN
dialogues.text: Wait, Sirius -- (CONTINUED )

dialogues.speaker: SIRIUS BLACK
dialogues.text: I did my waiting! Twelve years of it! In Azkaban! Trust me, you wouldn't have lasted a week! Lupin eyes Black, then nods.

dialogues.speaker: PROFESSOR LUPIN
dialogues.text: All right then. As you wish...

dialogues.speaker: HARRY
dialogues.text: No! Harry raises his wand when Lupin wheels and, with a flick of his own, disarms him. Furious, Harry eyes Black murderously.

dialogues.speaker: HARRY
dialogues.text: You betrayed my parents! You sold them to Voldemort!

dialogues.speaker: SIRIUS BLACK
dialogues.text: It's a lie! I never would've betrayed James and Lily!

dialogues.speaker: PROFESSOR LUPIN
dialogues.text: Harry! You've got to listen --

dialogues.speaker: HARRY
dialogues.text: Did he listen! When my mother was dying! Did he hear her screaming!

dialogues.speaker: SIRIUS BLACK
dialogues.text: No! I wasn't there! And I'll regret it the rest of my life! Harry's eyes flash to Black's, glittering with pain.

dialogues.speaker: PROFESSOR LUPIN
dialogues.text: Someone else betrayed your parents, Harry. Someone in this room right now. Someone who, until quite recently, I believed to be dead.

dialogues.speaker: SIRIUS BLACK
dialogues.text: He's as good as dead.

dialogues.speaker: HARRY
dialogues.text: What're you talking about? There's nobody here. (CONTINUED )

dialogues.speaker: SIRIUS BLACK
dialogues.text: Oh yes there is... Black turns then, to Ron, and CROONS in a cruel sing song:

dialogues.speaker: SIRIUS BLACK
dialogues.text: Come out, come out, Peter Come out, come out and play... Ron draws back from Black's demented gaze.

dialogues.speaker: RON
dialogues.text: You're mad... Harry's eyes shift from Ron's FACE to his HANDS, where Scabbers TWISTS violently. As a curious expression befalls Harry, Lupin and Black, as one, raise their wands... when.

dialogues.speaker: SNAPE
dialogues.text: Expelliarmus! The wands fly from their hands. The others turn, find Snape standing in the doorway, smiling smugly.

dialogues.speaker: SNAPE
dialogues.text: (eying Black) Ah, vengeance is sweet. How I hoped I'd be the one to catch you.

dialogues.speaker: PROFESSOR LUPIN
dialogues.text: Severus --

dialogues.speaker: SNAPE
dialogues.text: I told Dumbledore you were helping your old friend into the castle. And here's the proof.

dialogues.speaker: SIRIUS BLACK
dialogues.text: Brilliant! And -- as usual -- dead wrong. Now give us our wands back. Remus and I have a bit of unfinished business to tend to. As Black approaches, Snape puts his wand to Black's neck.

dialogues.speaker: SNAPE
dialogues.text: Give me a reason. I beg you.

dialogues.speaker: PROFESSOR LUPIN
dialogues.text: Don't be a fool, Severus! (CONTINUED )

dialogues.speaker: SIRIUS BLACK
dialogues.text: He can't help it. It's habit by now.

dialogues.speaker: PROFESSOR LUPIN
dialogues.text: Quiet, Sirius!

dialogues.speaker: SNAPE
dialogues.text: (clucking his tongue) Listen to you two. Quarreling like an old married couple. The creature and the criminal.

dialogues.speaker: SIRIUS BLACK
dialogues.text: Piss off.

dialogues.speaker: SNAPE
dialogues.text: Witty as ever I see. Tell me, will you be so irreverent when I turn you over to the Dementors? (as Black reacts) Do I detect a flicker of fear? One can only imagine what it must be like to endure the Dementor's Kiss. It's said to be unbearable to witness. But I'll do my best. Snape's eyes harden. He gestures to the door.

dialogues.speaker: SNAPE
dialogues.text: After you. As the others start to go, Harry glances at the table where Lupin has left Harry's wand. Ina flash, it's in his hand.

dialogues.speaker: HARRY
dialogues.text: Expelliarmus! Snape soars into the air, hits the wall with a THUD, and slides down. Ron and Hermione stare in shock.

dialogues.speaker: HERMIONE
dialogues.text: Harry. You attacked a teacher. Harry looks a bit shocked himself, then turns to Black.

dialogues.speaker: HARRY
dialogues.text: You said Peter before. Peter who?

dialogues.speaker: PROFESSOR LUPIN
dialogues.text: Pettigrew. He was at school with us. We thought he was a friend. (CONTINUED )

dialogues.speaker: HARRY
dialogues.text: No. Pettigrew's dead. He killed him. As Harry points at Black, Black laughs mirthlessly.

dialogues.speaker: PROFESSOR LUPIN
dialogues.text: I thought so, too. Until you mentioned seeing Pettigrew on the Map.

dialogues.speaker: HARRY
dialogues.text: The Map was lying then --

dialogues.speaker: SIRIUS BLACK
dialogues.text: The Map never lies. Pettigrew's alive. And he's right there. Black points at... Ron. Ron goes white with fear.

dialogues.speaker: RON
dialogues.text: M-me? It's lunatic...

dialogues.speaker: SIRIUS BLACK
dialogues.text: Not you, you idiot. Your rat.

dialogues.speaker: RON
dialogues.text: Scabbers? Scabbers has been in my family for --

dialogues.speaker: SIRIUS BLACK
dialogues.text: (bitterly) Twelve years. A curiously long life for a common garden rat. He's missing a toe, isn't he? Black unfolds a dog-eared clipping from The Daily Prophet: it shows Ron in Egypt with his family, Scabbers on his shoulder.

dialogues.speaker: RON
dialogues.text: So what?

dialogues.speaker: HARRY
dialogues.text: All they could find of Pettigrew was his --

dialogues.speaker: SIRIUS BLACK
dialogues.text: Finger. Dirty coward cut it off so everyone would think he was dead. Then he transformed into a rat. (CONTINUED )

dialogues.speaker: CONTINUED
dialogues.text: Harry stares into Black's sunken eyes. Wanting to believe. Desperate to believe. Glances at Ron, his agonized face. Scabbers SQUIRMS VIOLENTLY.

dialogues.speaker: HARRY
dialogues.text: Show me. Lupin and Black turn to Ron. He holds Scabbers protectively.

dialogues.speaker: RON
dialogues.text: What are you going to do to him? Sirius and Lupin exchange a glance.

dialogues.speaker: SIRIUS BLACK
dialogues.text: Together. With that, Lupin takes out his wand and, as one, he and Black cast a stream of BLUE-WHITE LIGHT. Scabbers twists madly in midair, then -- FLASH! -- transforms into... a very short man with thinning hair and grubby hands. PETER PETTIGREW.

dialogues.speaker: PETTIGREW
dialogues.text: S-Sirius... R-Remus. My old friends. Neither speaks. Pettigrew's small, watery eyes dart toward the windows and door. Suddenly, he makes a break for it, but Sirius merely shoves him back. Pettigrew's nose twitches, his gaze finding Harry. His hands flutter nervously, reveal a MISSING INDEX FINGER.

dialogues.speaker: PETTIGREW
dialogues.text: Harry! Look at you! Y-you look just like your father. Like James. We were the best of friends, he and I --

dialogues.speaker: SIRIUS BLACK
dialogues.text: Shut up!

dialogues.speaker: PETTIGREW
dialogues.text: I didn't mean to! The Dark Lord, you have no idea the weapons he possesses! Ask yourself what you would have done, Sirius. What would you have done! (CONTINUED )

dialogues.speaker: SIRIUS BLACK
dialogues.text: Died! Died rather than betray my friends! And you should have realized, Peter, if Voldemort didn't kill you...

dialogues.speaker: PROFESSOR LUPIN
dialogues.text: We would.

dialogues.speaker: PETTIGREW
dialogues.text: No... please... you can't... (eyes darting, finding) Ron! Haven't I been a good friend? A good pet? You won't let them kill me, will you? I was your rat... 99. 114 Ron draws back in disgust. Pettigrew turns to Hermione.

dialogues.speaker: PETTIGREW
dialogues.text: Sweet girl. Clever girl. Surely you won't let them... As one, Lupin and Black raise their wands, point them directly into Pettigrew's face. He shrinks back trembling, closing his eyes in fear, when...

dialogues.speaker: HARRY
dialogues.text: No. Pettigrew's lids lift. Lupin and Black turn.

dialogues.speaker: PROFESSOR LUPIN
dialogues.text: Harry, this man...

dialogues.speaker: HARRY
dialogues.text: I know what he is. But we'll take him to the castle.

dialogues.speaker: PETTIGREW
dialogues.text: Bless you, boy! Bless you --

dialogues.speaker: HARRY
dialogues.text: Get off! I said we'd take you to the castle. After that, the Dementors can have you.

dialogues.speaker: OMITTED
dialogues.text: Staggered. 115 116
117 As Pettigrew emerges from the gap, he prattles desperately:

dialogues.speaker: PETTIGREW
dialogues.text: Turn me into a maggot. A dung beetle. A Flobberworm! Anything but the Dementors... (as Ron emerges) Ron! Haven't I been a good friend? A good pet? You won't let them kill me, will you? I was your rat... As Ron draws back in disgust, a sleepwalking Snape BUMPS his head against a low limb. Hermione turns to Harry.

dialogues.speaker: HERMIONE
dialogues.text: Don't worry. He's under the Somnambulist Charm. It's primarily used to transport the seriously deranged. As Harry nods, Pettigrew's pleading eyes find Hermione.

dialogues.speaker: PETTIGREW
dialogues.text: Sweet girl. Clever girl. Surely you won't let them... Hermione tugs her robes from Pettigrew's sweaty grasp. Harry turns, sees Black staring in wonder at the castle, shining radiantly under the bright bowl of the night sky.

dialogues.speaker: SIRIUS BLACK
dialogues.text: Beautiful, isn't it? I'll never forget the first time I walked through those doors. It'll be nice to do it again. Freely. (turning to Harry) That was a noble thing you did back there. He doesn't deserve it. Harry studies Pettigrew briefly, looks away. thought.

dialogues.speaker: HARRY
dialogues.text: I don't reckon my father'd want his best friends to become killers for a worthless piece of vermin like Pettigrew. Besides: Dead, the truth dies with him. Alive... you're free. Lost in (CONTINUED )

dialogues.speaker: CONTINUED
dialogues.text: Sirius studies Harry's profile, moved by this.

dialogues.speaker: SIRIUS BLACK
dialogues.text: I don't know if you know, Harry, but when you were born, James and Lily made me your guardian...

dialogues.speaker: HARRY
dialogues.text: I know.

dialogues.speaker: SIRIUS BLACK
dialogues.text: And, well, I'll understand if you choose to stay with your aunt and uncle, but, so you know, you could --

dialogues.speaker: HARRY
dialogues.text: Come live with you? When!

dialogues.speaker: SIRIUS BLACK
dialogues.text: Soon as my name's cleared... Harry looks at Hogwarts. GRINS. Sirius does the same. Then, Hermione's voice rises on the air, quavering with fear.

dialogues.speaker: HERMIONE
dialogues.text: Harry... He turns, see Hermione staring at the FULL MOON. His eyes shift. Lupin is a rigid silhouette, his fingers twitching.

dialogues.speaker: SIRIUS BLACK
dialogues.text: Remus, old friend... did you take your potion tonight? Lupin, twitching, SHAKES HIS HEAD. Pettigrew's eyes dart, taking in the situation, then slowly shift, note the WAND trembling in LUPIN'S LENGTHENING FIST.

dialogues.speaker: SIRIUS BLACK
dialogues.text: Run. All of you. Now. But none of them do, transfixed, watching as BRISTLES POKE THROUGH LUPIN'S SKIN. Black steps forward, wraps his arms around his friend, presses his mouth to his ear.

dialogues.speaker: SIRIUS BLACK
dialogues.text: You know the man you truly are, Remus. This flesh is only flesh. (MORE ) (CONTINUED )

dialogues.speaker: CONTINUED
dialogues.text: SIRIUS BLACK (CONT'Dpounding Lupin's chest) This heart is where you truly live. This heart! Here! As Lupin's WAND DROPS... Pettigrew LEAPS.

dialogues.speaker: HARRY
dialogues.text: No! (flashing his wand) Expelliarmus! Lupin's wand flies from Pettigrew's hand and he FREEZES. Then slowly turns. Face blank, eyes closed, he... GRINS HIDEOUSLY. Transforms. Stunned, Harry watches a RAT dart into the night. A HOWL PIERCES THE AIR and Harry wheels. With a shrug, Lupin tosses Black into the air, then turns. He is no longer human. He's a werewolf. Harry and Hermione begin to edge back.

dialogues.speaker: HERMIONE
dialogues.text: Professor...? The WEREWOLF'S eyes blaze. Long teeth glitter. Then... a horrifying GROWL ERUPTS from its throat. Harry and Hermione spin, begin to flee... and run flat into Snape. As they collapse in a great clumsy pile, Snape's eyes flutter open, the spell broken. Seeing Hermione atop him, he sweeps her aside...

dialogues.speaker: SNAPE
dialogues.text: Out of the way! ... and finds the werewolf preparing to pounce. Leaping to his feet, Snape draws his wand and steps forward, shielding Hermione, Harry and Ron. The WEREWOLF HOWLS, SPRINTS forward, when -- SWOOSH! -- a GIANT DOG (Black) intercepts it in MIDAIR. They hit the ground in a FIERCE TANGLE of FLASHING TEETH, a single horrible flailing beast. Again and again, the dog pushes the werewolf back, but the werewolf is too strong...

dialogues.speaker: HARRY
dialogues.text: Sirius! The DOG YELPS, ROARS in pain, and the werewolf flings it into the tall grass. As it charges after, Harry pushes past Snape, dashes into the night. Hermione makes to follow, but Snape holds her back. (CONTINUED )

dialogues.speaker: HERMIONE
dialogues.text: Harry! Harry runs full out. Up ahead, FRAMED AGAINST A FULL MOON, he spies the dog, lying inert, the werewolf's razor-sharp claws suspended over its neck.

dialogues.speaker: NO
dialogues.text: Desperately, Harry plucks a THICK BRANCH from the ground and hurls it with all his might. Bull's-eye. The werewolf freezes. Turns. Begins to move toward... Harry. Harry draws his wand, terrified, but tormented as well, knowing Lupin dwells somewhere within the beast.

dialogues.speaker: HARRY
dialogues.text: Please, Professor. Stop... It's me. Suddenly... a HOWL pierces the night. The werewolf falters, cocking its head toward the forest. Harry waits, petrified. The WEREWOLF's eyes shift back to him. It SNARLS, moves closer, ready to kill. Harry covers his face with his arm, when... ++. a SECOND HOWL ECHOES high above the forest. Slowly, Harry drops his arm. Looks. The werewolf bounds toward the forest, vanishes. Harry's eyes shift. In the darkness, the wounded dog lurches through the tall grass. Falls. Rises. Falls again. Each time becoming more human. As he disappears over the ridge, Harry sprints after.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Harry stumbles down to Black, who lies on the water's edge, now fully a man, arms and face gleaming with lacerations.

dialogues.speaker: HARRY
dialogues.text: Sirius! Harry looks into his glassy eyes.

dialogues.speaker: HARRY
dialogues.text: Sirius! (CONTINUED )

dialogues.speaker: CONTINUED
dialogues.text: A fragile MIST escapes Harry's mouth. A raw WIND TOSSES his hair. CHILL-BUMPS pebble his SKIN. A FRINGE of ICE appears at the lake's edge. Then they appear, oozing like smoke through the TREES across the lake. Dementors.

dialogues.speaker: HARRY
dialogues.text: No... No! (drawing his wand) Expecto... Patronum! A thin silvery wisp weeps from Harry's wand, hovering like a VEIL, but the Dementors continue to come. Harry places his hand on Black's HEAVING HEART, poises his wand once more:

dialogues.speaker: HARRY
dialogues.text: Expecto... Patronum... Harry's Patronus blooms briefly... and dies. Harry's eyes flutter, the DEMENTORS twisting madly in his vision, drawing closer. Black GASPS. SILVERY FEATHERS of LIGHT tumble from his lips, as if his very soul were leaving him... Then... a LIGHT splinters the trees. Harry squints, sees a FIERY STAG appear... its body luminous... slashing through the trees... sowing light in the darkness. The Dementors wilt in its wake, but more replace them, sweeping down in waves. Still, the stag charges on. The LIGHT EXPANDS. The forest blazing with it. The remaining Dementors flee, drifting across the moon like ash. The light ebbs. The stag's luminous body flickers. There is a BRIGHT FLASH and darkness returns, a single THREAD of LIGHT all that remains, spinning down to the size of a PEARL... in the palm of MAN, standing deep in the trees. Harry studies the strangely familiar SILHOUETTE, then... it is gone. Silence drops like a curtain. MIST rises from the lake. As Snape appears at the top of the rise, we -- FADE TO BLACK.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: CAMERA PULLS BACK SLOWLY... out of HERMIONE'S SHADOW, which ripples against the curtain that encircles Harry's bed. A HAND reaches out -- Harry's hand -- and sweeps the CURTAIN ASIDE. Ron lies opposite, his leg BANDAGED. Hermione paces. Stops. (CONTINUED)

dialogues.speaker: HERMIONE
dialogues.text: Harry --

dialogues.speaker: HARRY
dialogues.text: I saw my dad.

dialogues.speaker: HERMIONE
dialogues.text: What...?

dialogues.speaker: HARRY
dialogues.text: He sent the Dementors away... I saw him. Across the lake... Hermione exchanges a private glance with Ron, turns back.

dialogues.speaker: HERMIONE
dialogues.text: Listen, Harry. They've captured Sirius. Any minute the Dementors are going to perform the Kiss.

dialogues.speaker: HARRY
dialogues.text: The Kiss...?

dialogues.speaker: HERMIONE
dialogues.text: It's what Dementors do to those they want to destroy. They clamp their jaws over the victim's mouth and... suck out his soul.

dialogues.speaker: HARRY
dialogues.text: You mean, they're going to kill Sirius?

dialogues.speaker: HERMIONE
dialogues.text: No. It's worse. Much worse. You go on living. But you have no memory. No sense of self. You're just a shall. An empty shell... As Harry reacts, the door opens and Dumbledore enters.

dialogues.speaker: HERMIONE
dialogues.text: Headmaster! You've got to stop them! They've got the wrong man!

dialogues.speaker: HARRY
dialogues.text: It's true, sir. Sirius is innocent --

dialogues.speaker: RON
dialogues.text: It's Scabbers who did it! (CONTINUED )

dialogues.speaker: DUMBLEDORE
dialogues.text: Scabbers...?

dialogues.speaker: RON
dialogues.text: My rat, sir. Only he's not really a rat. Well, he was a rat. You see, he used to be my brother Percy's --

dialogues.speaker: HERMIONE
dialogues.text: The point is... we know the truth. Please, sir, you must believe us.

dialogues.speaker: DUMBLEDORE
dialogues.text: I do, Miss Granger. But I'm sorry to say the word of three thirteen- year-old wizards will convince few others. A child's voice, however honest and true, is meaningless to those who have forgotten how to listen. As Dumbledore turns to the window, a SHOOTING STAR plummets silently through the sky.

dialogues.speaker: DUMBLEDORE
dialogues.text: Ah... a shooting star. If ever one was to make a wish, now would be the time. But time, I'm afraid, is precisely our problem... On cue, the MIDNIGHT BELL begins to CHIME... DING!...

dialogues.speaker: DUMBLEDORE
dialogues.text: Mysterious thing, time. Powerful. And, when meddled with... dangerous. Sirius Black is in the topmost cell of the Dark Tower. (to Hermione) You know the laws, Miss Granger. You must not be seen. And you would, I feel, do well to return before this last chime. If not... well, the consequences are really too ghastly to discuss. Three turns should do it, I think. If you succeed, more than one innocent life may be spared tonight. (CONTINUED )

dialogues.speaker: CONTINUED
dialogues.text: Dumbledore hands Harry and Hermione each a stick of CHOCOLATE, then starts to go... stops.

dialogues.speaker: DUMBLEDORE
dialogues.text: By the way, when in doubt, I find retracing my steps to be a wise place to begin... Good luck. He smiles, exits. Harry glances curiously at the chocolate.

dialogues.speaker: RON
dialogues.text: What in bloody hell was all that about? But Hermione doesn’t reply, instead looping the pendant's long chain around Harry's neck as well as her own.

dialogues.speaker: HERMIONE
dialogues.text: Sorry, Ron. But seeing as you can't walk... As Ron and Harry exchange a curious glance, the BELL continues to CHIME -- DING! DING! -- and...

dialogues.speaker: AFTERNOON
dialogues.text: TIME REVERSES in a dizzying backward blur, as if a tape were being rewound, every moment that occurred in the hospital room flickering by at a dizzying speed while, outside the window, darkness gives way to dusk and the sun "un-sets," returning to its place low on the horizon. At this point, the TIME REVERSAL ends and the room is... Empty. Except for Harry and Hermione. As Hermione unloops the necklace, Harry glances around in confusion.

dialogues.speaker: HARRY
dialogues.text: What just happened? Where's Ron? Hermione ignores the question, eyes the CLOCK on the wall.

dialogues.speaker: HERMIONE
dialogues.text: Seven-thirty. Where were we at seven-thirty?

dialogues.speaker: HARRY
dialogues.text: Huh? Dunno... going to Hagrid's? (CONTINUED )

dialogues.speaker: HERMIONE
dialogues.text: Come on! We can't be seen! Hermione grabs Harry's arm, slams through the door.

dialogues.speaker: OMITTED 120
dialogues.text: thru 122

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Harry and Hermione come to a mad, huffing halt.

dialogues.speaker: HARRY
dialogues.text: Hermione! Will you please tell me what it is we're doing?! She holds up a hand, silencing him. Annoyed, Harry follows her gaze and BLINKS in DISBELIEF. Across the grounds...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: ... he sees himself, along with Hermione and Ron, about to confront Malfoy, Crabbe, and Goyle near the monoliths.

dialogues.speaker: HARRY
dialogues.text: But that... that's... us. This is not... normal. INTERCUT BETWEEN BRIDGE AND SUNDIAL GARDEN. Dumbfounded, Harry turns. Hermione holds up the HOURGLASS

dialogues.speaker: HERMIONE
dialogues.text: This is a Time-Turner, Harry. McGonagall gave it to me first term. This is how I've been getting to my lessons all year.

dialogues.speaker: HARRY
dialogues.text: You mean, we've gone back in time?

dialogues.speaker: HERMIONE
dialogues.text: Yes. Dumbledore wanted us to return to this moment. Clearly something happened he wants us to change. (CONTINUED )

dialogues.speaker: CONTINUED
dialogues.text: A soft SMACK is HEARD. They turn, see Malfoy land on the seat of his pants in the Sundial Garden, rub his kisser.

dialogues.speaker: HARRY
dialogues.text: (in admiration) Good punch.

dialogues.speaker: HERMIONE
dialogues.text: Hurry! Malfoy's coming! Hermione pulls Harry under the bridge. Seconds later, FOOTSTEPS CLAMOR over their heads.

dialogues.speaker: DRACO, (0.S.)
dialogues.text: Not a word of this to anyone, understood! I'll get that jumped- up Mudblood one of these days. Mark my words... Eyes narrowed in anger, Hermione leans out, reaches up, and sends Malfoy SPRAWLING. As Harry pulls her back, Malfoy looks around in confusion, then dashes off with the others. Seconds later, Harry emerges, marvels at the sight of himself and Hermione, and Ron heading down the slope to Hagrid's hut. His eyes shift to the pumpkin patch.

dialogues.speaker: HARRY
dialogues.text: Look. Buckbeak's still alive.

dialogues.speaker: HERMIONE
dialogues.text: Of course! Remember what Dumbledore said. If we succeed, more than one innocent life could be spared.

dialogues.speaker: HARRY
dialogues.text: Buckbeak? But... how will saving Buckbeak help Sirius?

dialogues.speaker: HERMIONE
dialogues.text: We'll see.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: As Buckbeak feasts on a ferret, Harry and Hermione duck behind a pile of pumpkins. Peering into the hut, Harry sees Hermione and Ron embrace awkwardly. (CONTINUED )

dialogues.speaker: CONTINUED
dialogues.text: He grins, turns, only to find Hermione analyzing the moment with considerable fascination. Caught -- regards Harry defensively.

dialogues.speaker: HERMIONE
dialogues.text: What?

dialogues.speaker: HARRY
dialogues.text: Nothing. Harry looks toward the slope, sees Fudge and the others approaching in a CLOUD of CROWS.

dialogues.speaker: HARRY
dialogues.text: Here they come. I better hurry.

dialogues.speaker: HERMIONE
dialogues.text: No! Fudge has to see Buckbeak before we steal him. Otherwise, he'll think Hagrid set him free! Harry nods, then looks toward the hut. Inside, Hagrid is handing Scabbers to Ron.

dialogues.speaker: HARRY
dialogues.text: That's Pettigrew -- As he starts to rise, Hermione grabs him, speaks fiercely.

dialogues.speaker: HERMIONE
dialogues.text: No, Harry! You can't!

dialogues.speaker: HARRY
dialogues.text: Hermione, that's the man who betrayed my parents! You don't expect me to just sit here...

dialogues.speaker: HERMIONE
dialogues.text: Yes! You Must! (pointing inside) Harry, you're in Hagrid's hut right now. If you go bursting inside, you'll think you've gone mad. Awful things can happen when wizards meddle with time. We can't be seen. Hermione turns, watches Fudge and the others drawing closer. She frowns, glances into the hut. (CONTINUED )

dialogues.speaker: HERMIONE
dialogues.text: Fudge is coming and... we're not leaving... why aren't we leaving? Just then... on the ground beside her... Hermione notices a JAGGED STAR-SHAPED STONE. Instantly, she grabs it, rises, and hurls it through the OPEN WINDOW. SMASH! The sound of a GLASS JAR SHATTERING is heard within the hut.

dialogues.speaker: HARRY
dialogues.text: Are you mad? Hermione ignores him, swiftly whistling a second stone through the window and -- CONK! -- off the back of Harry's head.

dialogues.speaker: HARRY
dialogues.text: That hurt.

dialogues.speaker: HERMIONE
dialogues.text: Sorry. Crows begin to drop atop the roof. Fudge's party arrives, RAPS on the door.

dialogues.speaker: HERMIONE
dialogues.text: C'mon. Any minute now we're going to be coming out the back door. Quickly, Hermione and Harry dash into the trees directly behind... just in time to see themselves -- along with Ron -- exit the back door and slip behind the pumpkin pile where, only seconds before, they were hiding. As Fudge appears at the window and picks his nose as before, Hermione ponders the back of her own head.

dialogues.speaker: HERMIONE
dialogues.text: Is that really what my hair looks like from the back?

dialogues.speaker: HARRY
dialogues.text: Shhh! Hermione sees herself turn. Ducking, she accidentally stirs the branches, then peeks out and sees herself staring curiously at the branches DANCING ODDLY. Next she hears her own voice:

dialogues.speaker: HERMIONE, (0.S.)
dialogues.text: Nothing, I just thought I saw... Never mind. (CONTINUED )

dialogues.speaker: CONTINUED
dialogues.text: Harry and Hermione watch themselves start up the slope. The coast clear, they slip out of the trees.

dialogues.speaker: HERMIONE
dialogues.text: Now, Harry! As Harry vaults into the patch, the CROWS STIR, CAWING at his ankles, pecking at his feet.

dialogues.speaker: CORNELIUS FUDGE, (0.S.)
dialogues.text: 'It is the decision of the Committee for the Disposal of Dangerous Creatures that the Hippogriff Buckbeak, hereafter called the condemned, shall be executed this day at sundown...' As Harry approaches, Buckbeak studies him curiously, a ferret leg dangling from his beak. Harry bows. SLURP! The ferret leg disappears and Buckbeak returns Harry's nod. As Harry takes Buckbeak's chain... a flint-eyed crow PECKS his hand.

dialogues.speaker: HARRY
dialogues.text: Get away! Harry waves the crow away, yanks hard on Buckbeat's chain.

dialogues.speaker: CORNELIUS FUDGE, (0.S.)
dialogues.text: 'The Committee's appointed executioner shall dispatch the condemned by means of beheading...'

dialogues.speaker: HARRY
dialogues.text: C'mon, Buckbeak. Come on... Buckbeak refuses to move.

dialogues.speaker: CORNELIUS FUDGE, (0.S.)
dialogues.text: ‘As witnessed below.' You sign here, Hagrid. Very well, gentlemen. Let's step outside, shall we... DING! The Hogwarts BELL begins to TOLL. Harry and Hermione exchange a glance. Harry tugs harder. No go.

dialogues.speaker: DUMBLEDORE, (0.S.)
