dialogues.text: Excuse me, Minister. I believe I must sign as well... (CONTINUED )

dialogues.speaker: CONTINUED
dialogues.text: Harry PULLS at the chain, straining mightily... DING! when Hermione POPS UP, BOWS QUICKLY, and dangles a dead ferret before Buckbeak.

dialogues.speaker: HERMIONE
dialogues.text: Here, Beaky... Come and get the nice dead ferret... yum yum... Harry looks at her as if she's mad, but it's... working. As Buckbeak trots after, the CAWING CROWS scatter.

dialogues.speaker: DING
dialogues.text: Harry and Hermione lead Buckbeak away when the back door suddenly opens. They freeze... caught... Fudge's eyes drifting their way, when -- as before -- Dumbledore raises his hand and directs the attention of the others away from Buckbeak.

dialogues.speaker: DUMBLEDORE
dialogues.text: Professor Dippet had those blackberries planted when he was Headmaster... Harry and Hermione shoo Buckbeak along, disappear into the forest... just as Dumbledore concludes his reverie.

dialogues.speaker: CORNELIUS FUDGE
dialogues.text: Let's get this over with, shall we? Harry and Hermione -- their view unobstructed by the LOW STAND OF TREES this time -- watch the Executioner approach the pumpkin patch... and stop. Quickly, the confusion in his masked eyes turns to anger.

dialogues.speaker: CORNELIUS FUDGE
dialogues.text: But... where is it? I just saw the beast not moments ago -- Hagrid?

dialogues.speaker: HAGRID
dialogues.text: Beaky... Hearing Hagrid's husky voice, BUCKBEAK strains at his tether, WHIMPERS eerily. Hermione tosses him another ferret.

dialogues.speaker: DUMBLEDORE
dialogues.text: (a hint of amusement) How extraordinary! (CONTINUED )

dialogues.speaker: CORNELIUS FUDGE
dialogues.text: Come now, Dumbledore. Someone's obviously released him.

dialogues.speaker: HAGRID
dialogues.text: Professor, I swear! I didn't!

dialogues.speaker: DUMBLEDORE
dialogues.text: I'm quite sure the Minister isn't suggesting that you had anything to do with it, Hagrid. How could you? You've been with us all along.

dialogues.speaker: CORNELIUS FUDGE
dialogues.text: We should search the grounds --

dialogues.speaker: DUMBLEDORE
dialogues.text: Search the skies if you must, Minister. In the meantime, I wouldn't say no to a cup of tea, Hagrid. Or... a large brandy. (to the Executioner) It seems your services will no longer be required. The Executioner lifts his blade and -- with a brutal fury -- plunges it into the flesh of a PUMPKIN with a

dialogues.speaker: SICKENING
dialogues.text: The CROWS Harry and

dialogues.speaker: CHOP
dialogues.text: SCATTER to the skies.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Hermione race through the trees as Buckbeak lopes easily behind.

dialogues.speaker: HARRY
dialogues.text: Now what?

dialogues.speaker: HERMIONE
dialogues.text: We save Sirius.

dialogues.speaker: HARRY
dialogues.text: And we do that... how?

dialogues.speaker: HERMIONE
dialogues.text: No idea.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: SUBJECTIVE POV, GLIDING THROUGH a thicket of trees, TO the forest's edge, the trees thinning, REVEALING...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: ... the Whomping Willow THRASHING. Hermione disappears down the hole, then a FIGURE approaches the tree. Lupin. INTERCUT.

dialogues.speaker: HERMIONE
dialogues.text: Look. It's Lupin. As the Whomping Willow begins to thrash, its violence oddly muted at this distance, Lupin takes a stick, pokes a knot on the trunk. Instantly, the Willow calms.

dialogues.speaker: HARRY
dialogues.text: Wait until Fred and George hear about that one.

dialogues.speaker: HERMIONE
dialogues.text: Here comes Snape. As Lupin disappears into the gap at the base of the tree, Snape makes his way down the slope.

dialogues.speaker: HARRY
dialogues.text: And now we wait.

dialogues.speaker: HERMIONE
dialogues.text: Now we wait.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (LATER)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: We look UPWARD, see the tops of the trees etched against the darkening sky. BATS fly TOWARD us. We FOLLOW one, when Buckbeak snags one. A tail twitches briefly between his beak, then -- SLURP! -- is gone.

dialogues.speaker: HERMIONE
dialogues.text: ‘Least someone's enjoying himself. Harry and Hermione sit together in the lengthening shadows. Harry snaps off a piece of chocolate, hands it to Hermione.

dialogues.speaker: HARRY
dialogues.text: Hermione...

dialogues.speaker: HERMIONE
dialogues.text: Yes? (CONTINUED )

dialogues.speaker: HARRY
dialogues.text: Before. Down by the lake. When I was with Sirius... I did see someone... that someone made the Dementors go away...

dialogues.speaker: HERMIONE
dialogues.text: With a Patronus. I heard Snape telling Dumbledore when we were taken to the hospital. According to him, only a really powerful wizard could have conjured it.

dialogues.speaker: HARRY
dialogues.text: It was my Dad. Hermione looks at Harry.

dialogues.speaker: HARRY
dialogues.text: It was my Dad who conjured the Patronus.

dialogues.speaker: HERMIONE
dialogues.text: But, Harry, your Dad's...

dialogues.speaker: HARRY
dialogues.text: Dead. I know. I'm just telling you what I saw. Hermione nods, not wanting to press Harry further, then glances beyond the trees, toward the Whomping Willow.

dialogues.speaker: HERMIONE
dialogues.text: Here we come.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: SHADOWS emerge under a FULL MOON: Black. Harry. Pettigrew. Lupin. Hermione. Ron. Sleepwalking Snape...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Harry studies himself and Sirius.

dialogues.speaker: HARRY
dialogues.text: You see Sirius talking to me? He's asking me to come live with him.

dialogues.speaker: HERMIONE
dialogues.text: Really? (CONTINUED )

dialogues.speaker: CONTINUED
dialogues.text: Harry nods, his voice wistful.

dialogues.speaker: HARRY
dialogues.text: When we free him, I'll never have to go back to the Dursley's. I'm going to tell him I'd like to live someplace in the country. I think he'd like that, after all those years in Azkaban. We don't need a big place and I can help him... A HOWL pierces the night. Hermione glances toward the Willow.

dialogues.speaker: HERMIONE
dialogues.text: It's happened. Lupin's transformed.

dialogues.speaker: HARRY
dialogues.text: Which means Pettigrew is slipping safely into the night. While we just stand here... A FIERCE GROWLING is heard as twin silhouettes -- the DOG and the WEREWOLF -- bound into the tall grass. Harry watches himself appear, hurl the stick as before. The werewolf turns, begins to stalk... OWWWWWWWWW! Harry wheels, sees Hermione, hands cupped to her mouth, making a loud HOWL. He covers her mouth.

dialogues.speaker: HARRY
dialogues.text: What are you doing?

dialogues.speaker: HERMIONE
dialogues.text: Saving your life. Harry looks back to the tall grass. The werewolf is frozen. As before, it begins to approach Harry again. OWWWWWWWW! This time, Harry doesn't stop her.

dialogues.speaker: HARRY
dialogues.text: Thanks. But we have to move.

dialogues.speaker: HERMIONE
dialogues.text: Why?

dialogues.speaker: HARRY
dialogues.text: Because that werewolf you just called is running right this way. They exchange a glance and... RUN.  129 130

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Harry and Hermione dash for the lives, swing behind a HUGE TREE. As CAMERA BEGINS TO CIRCLE, the werewolf appears. Pauses. As it approaches the tree, Harry and Hermione silently sidestep in the opposite direction, until the werewolf... disappears. CAMERA CONTINUES TO CIRCLE the tree...

dialogues.speaker: HERMIONE
dialogues.text: Buckbeak. We've got to find him. --. and REVEALS the werewolf, fifteen feet past, waiting. As Harry and Hermione step out, they freeze. The werewolf poises itself, preparing to pounce, when... SKREEEK! The TREES shake with the fury of a HURRICANE and Buckbeak charges into the clearing, screening Harry and Hermione. The WEREWOLF SNARLS ANGRILY, makes to charge. With lightning-fast reflexes, Buckbeak's claws slash the air... only inches from the werewolf's face. The werewolf stops, eyes glittering with rage, then... HOWLS. Turning, it vanishes into the forest.

dialogues.speaker: HERMIONE
dialogues.text: Poor Professor Lupin is having a really tough night... Just then, a CHILL WIND rises... The LEAVES of the trees TREMBLE... EERIE SHADOWS flutter over the moon, greasy as smoke... Dementors.

dialogues.speaker: HARRY
dialogues.text: Let's go.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Looking UPWARD... THROUGH the trees as the sky wheels by, Dementors streaking IN AND OUT OF VIEW.

dialogues.speaker: LATER
dialogues.text: CAMERA RUSHES IN, HOLDS ON Harry and Hermione's faces. (CONTINUED )

dialogues.speaker: CONTINUED
dialogues.text: Shocked. Terror-stricken. Opposite them, across the lake...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: ++. a CYCLONE of DEMENTORS whirl madly above Harry and Black. INTERCUT BETWEEN BLACK LAKE AND EDGE OF FOREST. Harry watches himself vainly attempt to conjure a Patronus as the cyclone only continues to grow...

dialogues.speaker: HERMIONE
dialogues.text: This is horrible...

dialogues.speaker: HARRY
dialogues.text: Don't worry. My Dad will come... Right there... you'll see... he'll come... any minute... he'll conjure the Patronus Hermione eyes Harry warily. He is transfixed, staring hungrily toward the outcrop. The WIND RISES. The Lake begins to freeze. WHOOSH! WHOOSH! One after another, Dementors drop from the sky, vanish in the cyclone...

dialogues.speaker: HERMIONE
dialogues.text: No one's coming, Harry...

dialogues.speaker: HARRY
dialogues.text: HE WILL! He will come! She looks. Nothing. Desperately, her eyes flash to the cyclone, to the pitiful sight of Harry and Black at the water's edge... wracked with pain... dying...

dialogues.speaker: HERMIONE
dialogues.text: No one's coming! You're dying, both of you... and no one's coming! Harry's face changes. A riddle unravels. He draws his wand.

dialogues.speaker: HARRY, NO
dialogues.text: (CONTINUED )

dialogues.speaker: CONTINUED
dialogues.text: Too late. Harry slashes through the trees, down to the rocky outcrop, to the exact spot where his father appeared. Poising his wand, he looks out over the sea of Dementors on the other side of the lake.

dialogues.speaker: EXPECTO PATRONUM
dialogues.text: A WISP of SILVER escapes his wand, hovering like a MIST, then BLOOMS MAGNIFICENTLY. The trees EXPLODE WITH LIGHT. The Lake BLAZES with reflected FIRE. Harry stands utterly still, wand extended to the heavens. Across the lake, the Dementors retreat. Harry waits, still as a statue, until each and every one is gone. Then he simply lets his arm drop.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: WHOOSH! Harry and Hermione plunge INTO FRAME astride Buckbeak, SOARING toward the castle. Outside the grounds, the Dementors wait restlessly. Up ahead, Fudge and Snape enter the Dark Tower, TORCHES in hand.

dialogues.speaker: HARRY
dialogues.text: You were right, Hermione. It wasn't my dad I saw earlier. It was... me. I saw myself conjuring the Patronus before. I knew I could do it this time, because... because I'd already done it. Does that make sense? Hermione contemplates this.

dialogues.speaker: HERMIONE
dialogues.text: No. (looking down in fear) But I don't like this!

dialogues.speaker: LATER
dialogues.text: We see Buckbeak land.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Sirius paces within a SMALL CELL, a man condemned. Spying Harry and Hermione, he stops. Stunned to see them.  134 135 136 137 138 121.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Snape, TORCH in hand, leads the way as Fudge HUFFS after.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Hermione pushes past Harry.

dialogues.speaker: HERMIONE
dialogues.text: Out of the way! (raising her wand) Alohomora! Sirius tests the IRON DOOR. Still locked.

dialogues.speaker: HERMIONE
dialogues.text: Didn't really expect that to work.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Snape and Fudge draw closer...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Wand flashing, Hermione tries spell after spell.

dialogues.speaker: HERMIONE
dialogues.text: Dunamis! Liberare! Annihilare! Emancipare! No. No. No. No.

dialogues.speaker: SIRIUS BLACK
dialogues.text: You might try --

dialogues.speaker: HERMIONE
dialogues.text: Quiet! I'm trying to think. She resumes pacing, MUTTERING furiously. Then... stops. Turns.

dialogues.speaker: BOMBARDA
dialogues.text: KA-BOOM! The CELL DOOR ROCKETS to the sky.

dialogues.speaker: SIRIUS BLACK
dialogues.text: That'll do.

dialogues.speaker: NIGHT 138
dialogues.text: We see Buckbeak spirit Harry, Hermione and Sirius off the terrace and soar directly TOWARD us... Just as Snape and Fudge reach the top of the Tower.  139 140 122.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Sirius laughs, hair blowing in the wind.

dialogues.speaker: SIRIUS BLACK
dialogues.text: You truly are your father's son, Harry!

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Black puts his hands to Hermione's waist, swings her off Buckbeak and onto the ground next to Harry.

dialogues.speaker: SIRIUS BLACK
dialogues.text: I'll be forever grateful for this. To both of you.

dialogues.speaker: HARRY
dialogues.text: I want to go with you.

dialogues.speaker: SIRIUS BLACK
dialogues.text: One day perhaps. For some time... life will be too... unpredictable. Besides, you're meant to be here. Black claps his shoulder, looks him in the eye.

dialogues.speaker: SIRIUS BLACK
dialogues.text: But promise me something, Harry.

dialogues.speaker: HARRY
dialogues.text: Anything.

dialogues.speaker: SIRIUS BLACK
dialogues.text: Trust yourself. No matter the challenges you face -- and I fear they will be many -- you'll be surprised how many times you can find the answers... (tapping his heart) ..-here. As Sirius climbs atop Buckbeak, a SHOOTING STAR arcs through the heavens.

dialogues.speaker: SIRIUS BLACK
dialogues.text: A shooting star. Make a wish. WHACK! -- Black gives Buckbeak a SLAP and they soar into the glittering sky. Harry and Hermione stand watching, when... DING! They wheel. Look to the Clock Tower.

dialogues.speaker: HERMIONE
dialogues.text: We have to go. (CONTINUED )

dialogues.speaker: CONTINUED
dialogues.text: As Harry and Hermione dash off, CAMERA TRACKS AFTER, RISING WITH them as they race up the tower stairway, then passing through the mechanism and on through to the end of...

dialogues.speaker: OMITTED 141
dialogues.text: thru 143

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: .-.. the corridor. The Clock Tower BELL THUNDERS. The DOOR OPENS. Dumbledore backs out...

dialogues.speaker: DUMBLEDORE
dialogues.text: By the way, when in doubt, I always find retracing my steps to be a wise place to begin... Good luck. As Dumbledore begins to close the door, Harry and Hermione stumble frantically forward, the door about to hit the jamb, when... suddenly... Dumbledore stops. Looks up.

dialogues.speaker: DUMBLEDORE
dialogues.text: Well?

dialogues.speaker: HARRY
dialogues.text: He's free -- Sirius. We... we did it.

dialogues.speaker: DUMBLEDORE
dialogues.text: Did what? With a twinkle in his eye, Dumbledore swings open the door. As Harry and Hermione enter.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: ... they catch the faintest glimpse of... themselves... across the room... just as they EVAPORATE. Ron blinks. Turns. Frowns.

dialogues.speaker: RON
dialogues.text: How'd you two get over there? I was just talking to you... over there. (CONTINUED )

dialogues.speaker: CONTINUED
dialogues.text: Ron glances to the other side of the room. Frowns. Hermione glances mischievously to Harry.

dialogues.speaker: HERMIONE
dialogues.text: What d'you think, Harry? Too much for him -- everything that's happened tonight?

dialogues.speaker: HARRY
dialogues.text: Afraid so. Always been a bit of the nervous type, Ron has. Ron stares at them, confounded. Slowly, they... GRIN.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The Whomping Willow sways in a light breeze. The Black Lake shimmers, clouds drifting in its glassy mirror.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Harry walks softly toward an OPEN DOOR -- Lupin's office -- and peers in. Lupin stands over a battered suitcase, filling it with the last of his books. Without turning, he SPEAKS.

dialogues.speaker: PROFESSOR LUPIN
dialogues.text: Hello, Harry. Harry JUMPS. Lupin turns, smiles through haggard eyes.

dialogues.speaker: PROFESSOR LUPIN
dialogues.text: Saw you coming. The Marauder's Map lies open on an otherwise bare desk. Harry nods, looks back to Lupin. Unable to disguise his shock at Lupin's appearance.

dialogues.speaker: PROFESSOR LUPIN
dialogues.text: I've looked worse, believe me. Harry eyes the open desk drawers... the bare bookshelves...

dialogues.speaker: HARRY
dialogues.text: You've been sacked.

dialogues.speaker: PROFESSOR LUPIN
dialogues.text: Resigned, actually. (CONTINUED )

dialogues.speaker: HARRY
dialogues.text: Resigned! But why!

dialogues.speaker: PROFESSOR LUPIN
dialogues.text: It seems that someone has let slip the nature of my condition.

dialogues.speaker: HARRY
dialogues.text: Snape.

dialogues.speaker: PROFESSOR LUPIN
dialogues.text: Whoever. It was bound to get out. This time tomorrow, the owls will start arriving. Parents will not want a -- someone like me -- teaching their children.

dialogues.speaker: HARRY
dialogues.text: But Dumbledore --

dialogues.speaker: PROFESSOR LUPIN
dialogues.text: Has already risked enough on my behalf. Besides, people like me, well... let's just say I'm used to this by now. But before I go, tell me about your Patrons.

dialogues.speaker: HARRY
dialogues.text: Well. At first I thought it was a horse, or perhaps a unicorn, but I think it was --

dialogues.speaker: PROFESSOR LUPIN
dialogues.text: A stag.

dialogues.speaker: HARRY
dialogues.text: Yes.

dialogues.speaker: PROFESSOR LUPIN
dialogues.text: Your father used to transform into one. That's how he was able to keep me company when I became... sick. He was a great friend James. Lupin smiles wanly, lifts his sorry suitcase. Then stops. There are

dialogues.speaker: PROFESSOR LUPIN
dialogues.text: stories about him and your mother, you know. Some are even true. But I think it's safe to say, in the end, you'll know them best by getting to know yourself. Lupin then -- with a wicked twinkle -- raises his wand. (CONTINUED )

dialogues.speaker: PROFESSOR LUPIN
dialogues.text: Mischief managed. Harry watches the Map go blank. Looks back. Lupin is gone.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Ron stands amid a circle of excited Gryffindors.

dialogues.speaker: RON
dialogues.text: Stand back, I said! I'1l take it upstairs if you don't settle! As Harry arrives, he glances at Hermione, who CLEARS HER THROAT LOUDLY. The others turn, begin all speaking at once.

dialogues.speaker: NEVILLE
dialogues.text: Harry! Wherever did you get it!

dialogues.speaker: SEAMUS
dialogues.text: Can I have a go, Harry? After you, of course --

dialogues.speaker: RON
dialogues.text: Quiet!

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (as they oblige) Thank you. Let the man through. Mystified, Harry steps forward, the boys peeling away, clearing his view of the BROOMSTICK in Ron's hands. The

dialogues.speaker: HARRY
dialogues.text: Whose is that?

dialogues.speaker: RON
dialogues.text: (as everyone laughs) Whose is it? It's yours, mate.

dialogues.speaker: HARRY
dialogues.text: But... how? Who?

dialogues.speaker: HERMIONE
dialogues.text: It's a mystery. Though fell out of the wrapping. - this

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Harry turns, sees Hermione holding up a FEATHER. (CONTINUED )

dialogues.speaker: HARRY
dialogues.text: That's a Hippogriff feather -- As Harry stops short, Hermione raises her eyebrow. As they share a secret glance, we... cut TO:

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: BOOM! The huge vertical DOORS BURST OPEN and Harry, trailed by the others, exits with the Firebolt. As he strides off, others join the assembly -- Hagrid, Malfoy, Crabbe, and Goyle among them -- curious to see what the commotion is all about.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: As Harry stops, an expectant HUSH hangs over the moment.

dialogues.speaker: SEAMUS
dialogues.text: Go on, Harry.

dialogues.speaker: NEVILLE
dialogues.text: Yeah. Let's see. Harry mounts the broom. Licks his finger and jabs it in the air. A few others do the same. Hagrid does the same. Crabbe and Goyle start to do the same, when Malfoy SLAPS their hands down. Finally, Harry places his hand on the broom. Sets his grip. Takes a breath. And... Frowns.

dialogues.speaker: FRED/GEORGE
dialogues.text: What's wrong?

dialogues.speaker: HARRY
dialogues.text: I don't think it works. I think it's defective. A collective GROAN. Dejected, many of the kids begin to drift toward the castle. Harry calls after.

dialogues.speaker: HARRY
dialogues.text: Oh, come on now. It's just a broom.

dialogues.speaker: HAGRID
dialogues.text: (nodding sagely) Just a broom. (CONTINUED )

dialogues.speaker: CONTINUED
dialogues.text: Harry's eye shifts to Ron and Hermione. A wink.

dialogues.speaker: HARRY
dialogues.text: The fastest broom in the world. As everyone turns -- WHOOSH! -- Harry JETS OFF and we --

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: A tiny DOT, GROWING LARGER AND LARGER, races upward. It's Harry shooting straight into the blue on the Firebolt. A SCREAM GROWS LOUDER as he approaches. A scream of release, of utter abandon. It's Harry screaming. But something else is clear as he JETS PAST and... The SCREEN GOES BLACK. It's a SCREAM of joy. FADE OUT.
